'}, {'account_id': 860, 'date': '2013-09-23 12:00:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 860, 'date': '2013-09-23 15:10:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'll take back some of my comments. Looking at other code where container/obj name is in headers (e.g., X-Copy-From), it's clear that the expectation is that the header should be URL-encoded by the user. So in DELETE, it's correct to urllib.unquote the x-versions-location headers value. I need to re-read to understand why you don't appear to need this on the PUT path."}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2013-09-23 16:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

The object PUT path does unquote object_versions - it is used as the Destination header in the version COPY request, which is unquoted to set path_info in the COPY function, line 1238. I think the bug arises from the DELETE path not similarly unquoting object_versions, so looking for object versions in a different container than where they were put.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2013-09-24 16:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2013-09-24 16:24:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Fix utf-8 handling in object versions.

Fixes object versioning when object name and/or version
container name contain multibyte utf-8 characters.

When object names containing non-ASCII characters
are PUT multiple times into a container with an
x-versions-location set, subsequent DELETE of the
object results in a 500 response status.

When the versions container name contains
non-ASCII characters the first delete of an object
succeeds but fails to restore previous version of
object, so second delete incorrectly returns 404.

Fixes bug 1229142

Change-Id: I425440f76b8328f8e119d390bfa4c7022181e89e

commit_message:
add some negative tests for volume updating:

- test_update_volume_with_nonexistant_volume_id
- test_create_volume_with_size_negative
- test_update_volume_with_invalid_volume_id
- test_update_volume_with_empty_volume_id

Change-Id: Iee8510303b2643c065a662655ac2b4e44611ba84

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-10-08 18:31:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I'll admit I didn't like the new homes for some of these utility functions, so I support this revert in spirt.

But the first time we tried moving these things around we missed bin & probetests and it took us bit to track everything down - so I'm leery of doing this so close to an RC.

OTOH, I grepped best I could since we're just putting them back where they were maybe it's less risky.

Despite my grumbling I am actually pretty sure moving things that are *only* used by the backend processes (storage_location_gen) out of common.utils makes a lot of sense; so it's too bad to loose that.  And since the other stuff was over and done with I was also willing to swallow this one down as "sleep in the bed you made" sort of lesson.

If anyone else thinks it should or should not go forward - probably better speak up!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-08 19:22:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-10-08 19:22:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Alright, I'm okay with putting this back, mostly because the move would hose third-party middlewares that import stuff, and middleware authors should probably have a little more lead time than a week.

I've been holding off on this one to see if it this was its final form, but since it seems to have settled, I'm okay with putting it back now and waiting until post-release to start moving things around (if we do it at all)."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-08 20:31:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Fails

commit_message:
Get rid of PyPI URL override in integration test

* tools/integration.sh: Overriding the PyPI URL is logic best left
to devstack-gate since it does those things already. Remove the
similar dance found here.

Change-Id: Ie2fcabb11b30dc3ab6564bdedd55b2b173c1bf2a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 22:09:25.000000000', 'message': "Make `update_test` compatible with nose

Nose's default test-finder will look for tests matching 'test*' and '*test'.

This means that nose will treat `update_test` as a test itself and attempt to
call it directly, not what we want!

Fortunately, nose has a rule to ignore tests with leading underscores, so we
can just prefix with that, as we've done elsewhere.

Change-Id: I81943241948e60989c99d5ae17cd4b5c2b1a7a23
"}]
commit_message:
Make `update_test` compatible with nose

Nose's default test-finder will look for tests matching 'test*' and '*test'.

This means that nose will treat `update_test` as a test itself and attempt to
call it directly, not what we want!

Fortunately, nose has a rule to ignore tests with leading underscores, so we
can just prefix with that, as we've done elsewhere.

Change-Id: I81943241948e60989c99d5ae17cd4b5c2b1a7a23

commit_message:
Call a script to check for ERRORs in logs on tempest success

Since this script does not exist pre-havana the call is skipped for those
test runs. Stress tests already do their own checks. The check_logs script
has a whitelist for existing errors that is maintained in tempest and
should be reduced as bugs causing spurious errors are fixed.

Partially implements blueprint fail-gate-on-log-errors

Change-Id: I21438ce6aa178c3e02ac98d98df9ed88a646d8ce

commit_message:
Add notification on deleting instance without host

If an instance which does not have a host associated is deleted, the
corresponding notifications were not being sent. Fixed the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1211742

Change-Id: I56482ab38725e6f1ddfb14350637d329f35095b3

subject: Don't apply timeout to Pool.get operation (leaks)

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-10-04 19:49:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I think this makes sense, nice catch.

The tests fixes look good - but this particular bug doesn't seem to cause a test failure when I unapply the timeout change in `swift/common/memcached.py` - sorta wish it did.

I probably need to fire up a multi-node proxy with a real memcache ring and try out *all* this new code to see if anything else like this pops.  This may not be the last tweak we want to get in on this enhancement before we cut H."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-10-04 22:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

On a single node memecache "ring" that's running slowly this definitely fixes a possible connection swell - which is bad since we seem to be trying to impose a real way to actually limit these connections pools.  I didn't run this (or the previous changes) on a multi-node setup - presumably all the handoff stuff on timeouts still works.

I think it would help folks trying to review/understand the issue if you had a unittest to demonstrate the problem.  I think if you copy the one test you're fixing up, but mock at Pool.get to introduce some lag on the blocking call to get; but you let the "sockets" come out as fast as they want - you can create a test that will fail on master.  But I'm not worried about it enough to write it.'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-10-07 15:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-10-07 15:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script.'}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2013-10-07 15:31:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

My concern about removing the Timeout for the .get is the following:

In the case that memcached is backing up or failing in some way (and thus the connections aren't returning fast enough because requests are taking too long), those .get will continue to block, and requests will backup, without being able timeout and fall back to getting the data outside of cache.

I have no doubt that this overall logic could be made better, but I don't think this is the best way to do it."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-07 16:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-10-08 01:56:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

The big added comment seems to indicate that the timeout around IO will save us from a full pool, but I think that might not always work.

Consider a slow memcached (on a box that's swapping like mad). Imagine there's 2 active connections to it, plus a few greenthreads waiting to get their hands on a connection to it.

Now, let's say our greenthread goes to set a value in that slow memcached. The set() method looks like this:

        for (server, fp, sock) in self._get_conns(key):
            try:
                with Timeout(self._io_timeout):
                    sock.sendall(blah blah)

I think that, in _get_conns(), we'll end up going into MemcacheConnPool.get(), and that'll head on up into Pool.get(). Now, since we've already got 2 active connections, Pool.get() will not call MemcacheConnPool.create(); instead, it'll wait for a connection to become available.

Now, it's true that the greenthread with the connection will timeout after _io_timeout seconds, but then one of the greenthreads in line in front of us will get the connection and take _io_timeout seconds to time out, and then another queued greenthread will take another _io_timeout, and finally we'll get our hands on a connection and time out... *but* we took way longer than _io_timeout to do it.

Now, it's entirely possible that I've missed something; I haven't spent more than 20 minutes looking at this patch. However, I think the removed timeout was actually important to provide an upper bound on time spent waiting for a connection.

(also a couple nitpicks that you might fix someday, though they're not worth pushing a new patch set over)"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-10-08 05:05:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Just re-adding my support; although I agree with everything Sam said, I don't think allowing a new connection to be opened to the mis-behaving memcache server is a solution to anything.

Maybe after we fix the leak, we do something like this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/50219/"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-09 00:09:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-10-09 00:09:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Clay pointed out in IRC that the server will get error-limited after timeouts, so  a client will not be stuck retrying forever, but will go to the next server after just one timeout of _io_timeout seconds.

Since behavior without this patch is for the pool size to grow without bound, and the behavior with this patch is for some timeouts to be larger than expected, I'll call it a net win. 

I'd definitely like to see https://review.openstack.org/50219 looked at too, as I think that'll fix the over-long timeouts here."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-09 01:31:22.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-09 01:31:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-04 12:21:34.000000000', 'message': 'Don't apply timeout to Pool.get operation (leaks)

The connection timeout to a memcache server is performed by using the
"with Timeout()" construct over the sock.connect() call in the
.create() method. In addition, the same construct was being applied to
the Pool.get() call in ._get_conns().

If the maximum number of connections was already created, and the
Pool.get() called took longer than the connect timeout, then the error
handling path would add a place holder to the connection
pool. Eventlet's Pool class allows for additional items to be added to
the pool, over and above the max_size setting. This additional place
holder will eventually be pulled and a new connection created to take
its place.

The fix is to remove the timeout construct in the _get_conns() method.

In addition, we also apply the unit test patch mentioned in the review
comments for Patch Set 6 of https://review.openstack.org/45134,
located at http://paste.openstack.org/show/47288/.

Fixes bug 1235027

Change-Id: I786cabefe3e8ddf7d92feb7ebc7cfb613d60a1da
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Don't apply timeout to Pool.get operation (leaks)

The connection timeout to a memcache server is performed by using the
"with Timeout()" construct over the sock.connect() call in the
.create() method. In addition, the same construct was being applied to
the Pool.get() call in ._get_conns().

If the maximum number of connections was already created, and the
Pool.get() called took longer than the connect timeout, then the error
handling path would add a place holder to the connection
pool. Eventlet's Pool class allows for additional items to be added to
the pool, over and above the max_size setting. This additional place
holder will eventually be pulled and a new connection created to take
its place.

The fix is to remove the timeout construct in the _get_conns() method.

In addition, we also apply the unit test patch mentioned in the review
comments for Patch Set 6 of https://review.openstack.org/45134,
located at http://paste.openstack.org/show/47288/.

Fixes bug 1235027

Change-Id: I786cabefe3e8ddf7d92feb7ebc7cfb613d60a1da
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

going from nova-vol to cinder-uuid's.

commit_message:
Remove old_name from kwargs when using IET helper.

The IET driver passes the input kwargs from export
directly to the IET driver, but one of the keys here
is specifically for migration and a bug associated with
going from nova-vol to cinder-uuid's.

This patch just checks in the IET code if we have the key set
and if so pops it out before passing through to iet.

Cherry picked: db991e6638533fb019fa5dcf59235d7302ae426e
Fixes bug: 1175207
Fixes bug: 1212206

Change-Id: I965bdfbe078d61b906aebc48961c1806a9fb0c59

commit_message:
Improve output of test.py

Previously you got for both syntax and niceness checks:
Validating files...
Validation passed, validated 3 files.

Now we get different messages like:
Checking syntax of xml files...
Check passed, validated 3 xml files.

Checking niceness of xml files...
Check passed, validated 3 xml files.

Change-Id: I5bb0b014b743826094aae274fa730eb73ba1621e

commit_message:
Updated user and group in debian params.

The havana release of horizon has the wsgi process
user and group as horizon in the debian packages.

Closes-bug: #1224770

commit_message:
Proposed example of inclusion via template resource

In this example, the lib is invoked twice as a nested
template in source.

commit_message:
Add a local-files.html to easyily read locally build manuals

Just point your browser to doc/local-files.html and read all the
books you have build locally.
Also, a few handy references to online resources have been added.

Change-Id: I43b5b80e98611d3983fd407d7db49a1e037bdf34

commit_message:
Included content for ceilometer CLI section in user guide

Included section 'Metering' in the CLI chapter with some basic
commands for listing alarms, meters, statistics etc. Also included
the list of commands, optional arguments in the Appendix-Command
Reference. Made minor updates according to review comments.
Partial-Bug: #1201459

Change-Id: I42b18fea1f8eec2df8d78cb1dd55f4cb03766feb

[{'created': '2013-10-08 22:31:06.000000000', 'message': 'Update PCI passthrough and SR-IOV glossary entries.

PCI Passthrough and, as a result, SR-IOV are available from OpenStack
Havana onwards. As such the relevant glossary entries have been updated
to indicate that these previously unsupported virtualization
technologies are now supported.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/pci-passthrough-base
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/pci-passthrough-libvirt

Change-Id: I7468f62465ef5eaccefbb5dd188571965f987b3d
'}]
commit_message:
Update PCI passthrough and SR-IOV glossary entries.

PCI Passthrough and, as a result, SR-IOV are available from OpenStack
Havana onwards. As such the relevant glossary entries have been updated
to indicate that these previously unsupported virtualization
technologies are now supported.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/pci-passthrough-base
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/pci-passthrough-libvirt

Change-Id: I7468f62465ef5eaccefbb5dd188571965f987b3d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 23:56:07.000000000', 'message': 'Remove redundant installation of openstack-utils.

Fedora/RHEL installation of openstack-utils package was mentioned twice,
once in the messaging server command and once later after repository
configuration.

As only the second instance will actually work (as openstack-utils is
from the repository being configured) the first has been removed.

Change-Id: I19eda3b9c177649cbfb873922b776133ae32569b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant installation of openstack-utils.

Fedora/RHEL installation of openstack-utils package was mentioned twice,
once in the messaging server command and once later after repository
configuration.

As only the second instance will actually work (as openstack-utils is
from the repository being configured) the first has been removed.

Change-Id: I19eda3b9c177649cbfb873922b776133ae32569b

commit_message:
Revoke user tokens when disabling/delete a tenant

Revoke tokens scoped to all users from a tenant when disabling or
deleting the tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1179955
Change-Id: I8ab4713d513b26ced6c37ed026cec9e2df78a5e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 07:40:32.000000000', 'message': "remove unused methods in driver.Scheduler

cinder.scheduler.host_manager.HostManager doesn't have get_host_list()
and get_service_capabilities(). But we don't catch the AttributeError
by them. Therefore, get_host_list() and get_service_capabilities() in
cinder.scheduler.driver.Scheduler have not been used.

Also, get_host_list() and get_service_capabilities() in
cinder.scheduler.manager.SchedulerManager have not been used.

Change-Id: I402cf068612866649cc8645391eff38fca56f634
Closes-Bug: #1236723
"}]
commit_message:
remove unused methods in driver.Scheduler

cinder.scheduler.host_manager.HostManager doesn't have get_host_list()
and get_service_capabilities(). But we don't catch the AttributeError
by them. Therefore, get_host_list() and get_service_capabilities() in
cinder.scheduler.driver.Scheduler have not been used.

Also, get_host_list() and get_service_capabilities() in
cinder.scheduler.manager.SchedulerManager have not been used.

Change-Id: I402cf068612866649cc8645391eff38fca56f634
Closes-Bug: #1236723

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-04 07:14:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix chown fail for nfs file without necessary permission

chown failed in case of volumes on nfs export when the
permission is not granted on the storage system. Upload
volume only requires read access on the nfs file and hence
chown is not neccessary when current user has read permission.
Chown only executed when read is not granted to the user.

Conflicts:

	cinder/image/image_utils.py

Change-Id: Ifa8eff7e79c6e4f15a1feb7cabec8cae8a0b0a83
Closes-Bug:#1221205
(cherry picked from commit 1498958299ccb807f406e9d257848cb4259e49e4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix chown fail for nfs file without necessary permission

chown failed in case of volumes on nfs export when the
permission is not granted on the storage system. Upload
volume only requires read access on the nfs file and hence
chown is not neccessary when current user has read permission.
Chown only executed when read is not granted to the user.

Conflicts:

	cinder/image/image_utils.py

Change-Id: Ifa8eff7e79c6e4f15a1feb7cabec8cae8a0b0a83
Closes-Bug:#1221205
(cherry picked from commit 1498958299ccb807f406e9d257848cb4259e49e4)

commit_message:
Fix check for mount.nfs helper installation

This fixes the issue for checking the
existence of mount.nfs helper program
in installation directories during
driver set up.

Closes-Bug:#1212286

Change-Id: If2fa925614bd42295eae0f62ba948e14a89e1343
(cherry picked from commit efd82e0265efbbfa43ff7ebb7523790b81299882)

quote the values instead

commit_message:
Remove error on launching WordPress_NoKey template

Receive error:
ROR: Property error : WebServerSecurityGroup: SecurityGroupIngress
  SecurityGroupIngress: 0 0: FromPort Value must be a string

quote the values instead

Change-Id: I96c3dfb850105219c144be293f93e010f271c5e2

Infra team has indicated that tearDown should not be used, and should
be replaced with addCleanup in all places. This patch removes the

commit_message:
Replace tearDown with addCleanup in unit tests

Infra team has indicated that tearDown should not be used, and should
be replaced with addCleanup in all places. This patch removes the
few cases of tearDown in Ironic.

Change-Id: Ie2a59ea018c68fccadf0530409255bd9a0cf9717

According to the comment in the source code, the snapshot-update of
v2 would be able to allow either "name" or "display_name" parameter.
And if both paramters are specified, "name" parameter is effective
over "display_name" like "description" parameter.
However "display_name" parameter is ignored now, because cinder writes
over empty dict(update_dict['display_name']).

This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: Icd48556a26b9346f73b7c1b82ffbcdd469c4d28d
(cherry picked from commit 622f10e87fda5dc439d43543216d953920079282)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow display_name for v2 snapshot-update

According to the comment in the source code, the snapshot-update of
v2 would be able to allow either "name" or "display_name" parameter.
And if both paramters are specified, "name" parameter is effective
over "display_name" like "description" parameter.
However "display_name" parameter is ignored now, because cinder writes
over empty dict(update_dict['display_name']).

This patch fixes the problem.

Fixes bug #1226398

Change-Id: Icd48556a26b9346f73b7c1b82ffbcdd469c4d28d
(cherry picked from commit 622f10e87fda5dc439d43543216d953920079282)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-27 02:41:10.000000000', 'message': "Pop out 'offset' and 'limit' before use for filter

In previous code of _items() from api/v{1,2}/snapshots.py,
and also the _items)_ from api/v1/volume.py.we didn't pop
out the 'offset' and 'limit' fields from HTTP get params
before we use such params for filter.This is the root cause
for bug #1205956

For non-admin user, since 'offset' and 'limit' is not in the
allowed_search_options, so the volumes.remove_invalid_options
will help to filter them out. As a result, it walks around this
bug.

But for admin user,the volumes.remove_invalid_options will not
try to filter the search_options.So for admin user, the 'limit'
will appear in search_options, then obviously get no result.

fixed bug #1205956

Change-Id: Ib1a66c9d104ac52d6eae18be7f06d02985d4c2fd
(cherry picked from commit 08af981ffc104d7cb836c1b674e1d73724eeaf88)
"}]
commit_message:
Pop out 'offset' and 'limit' before use for filter

In previous code of _items() from api/v{1,2}/snapshots.py,
and also the _items)_ from api/v1/volume.py.we didn't pop
out the 'offset' and 'limit' fields from HTTP get params
before we use such params for filter.This is the root cause
for bug #1205956

For non-admin user, since 'offset' and 'limit' is not in the
allowed_search_options, so the volumes.remove_invalid_options
will help to filter them out. As a result, it walks around this
bug.

But for admin user,the volumes.remove_invalid_options will not
try to filter the search_options.So for admin user, the 'limit'
will appear in search_options, then obviously get no result.

fixed bug #1205956

Change-Id: Ib1a66c9d104ac52d6eae18be7f06d02985d4c2fd
(cherry picked from commit 08af981ffc104d7cb836c1b674e1d73724eeaf88)

[{'created': '2013-10-08 22:06:58.000000000', 'message': 'Close the cursor for SQLite for 034 upgrade/downgrade on select

The list() is needed around the table select for SQLite upgrade/downgrade
to work.  This forces a cursor close and prevents database locked errors.

closes-bug: 1233329
Change-Id: I01aedf9d2743a86881c124c9690f10233d9966bc
'}]
commit_message:
Close the cursor for SQLite for 034 upgrade/downgrade on select

The list() is needed around the table select for SQLite upgrade/downgrade
to work.  This forces a cursor close and prevents database locked errors.

closes-bug: 1233329
Change-Id: I01aedf9d2743a86881c124c9690f10233d9966bc

commit_message:
Handle DB2 disconnect

If the DB2 server was restarted, database connections would fail,
requiring a restart of the Keystone server.

This change adds an on-checkout handler for DB2 similar to the
MySQL handler.

Change-Id: Ie53d9606edac408401961fc6526bb7c99baa836a
Closes-Bug: #1231657

commit_message:
Preserve overcloud passwords across iterations

In order to make devetest_overcloud.sh ready to support continuous
deployment, we want to preserve the same tripleo-overcloud-passwords across
runs. Change setup-*-passwords to not raise an error (exit 1) when a
password file already exists.

Change setup-undercloud-passwords to make things uniform.

Change-Id: I7f9e50cf18821fc2b07599033870c5a33ba57931

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-03 15:34:15.000000000', 'message': "Change pyrax identity_type of Rackspace resources

The Rackspace resources utilize the pyrax library. As of v1.4.11 of
pyrax, the manner in which default region is determined changed, such
that the keystone identity_type returned 'RegionOne' as the default
region rather than one of the Rackspace regions. Changing the
identity_type to rackspace fixes this.

Change-Id: I36cd61393a76fbb9b0bb1fd4b31f26f6a95df3a3
Closes-Bug: 1227387
"}]
commit_message:
Change pyrax identity_type of Rackspace resources

The Rackspace resources utilize the pyrax library. As of v1.4.11 of
pyrax, the manner in which default region is determined changed, such
that the keystone identity_type returned 'RegionOne' as the default
region rather than one of the Rackspace regions. Changing the
identity_type to rackspace fixes this.

Change-Id: I36cd61393a76fbb9b0bb1fd4b31f26f6a95df3a3
Closes-Bug: 1227387

commit_message:
Move the registration of the global env to after plugin resources

This prevents a user's template resources from getting overridden
by a resource plugin.

Change-Id: Idd1a5155dd28d662df8cdc44d190e24c84fd7a81
Closes-bug: #1236107

commit_message:
Make the testing of resource loading easier

Pass an environment object around so tests don't have
to use the global object and then conflict with other tests.

Change-Id: I0d9a0d3bd825ac415847213ee4a5d7473f80dbd6
Partial-bug: #1236107

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-07 23:30:57.000000000', 'message': 'Don't try validate TemplateResource properties in template_validate

If the user runs "heat template-validate ..." and one of the resources
is a TemplateResource we won't be able to validate the properties
of that resource as we have to instantiate the TemplateResource
to kick off downloading the template and conversion of parameters to
properties.
Note: validation will happen properly when the user creates the stack
      so this just delays the validation of one resource type by one step.

Change-Id: I6ce53a9e78ae470b54320862fe910eef9f603941
Closes-bug: #1236327
'}]
commit_message:
Don't try validate TemplateResource properties in template_validate

If the user runs "heat template-validate ..." and one of the resources
is a TemplateResource we won't be able to validate the properties
of that resource as we have to instantiate the TemplateResource
to kick off downloading the template and conversion of parameters to
properties.
Note: validation will happen properly when the user creates the stack
      so this just delays the validation of one resource type by one step.

Change-Id: I6ce53a9e78ae470b54320862fe910eef9f603941
Closes-bug: #1236327

commit_message:
Fix l2 pop doesn't propagate ip address updates

Propagates ip address changes when an ip address is :
added, removed, or changed.
Add a new rpc call for the updates of forwarding informations.

Fixes: Bug #1234137
Change-Id: Ib5b971bd02f20a0ea73f88ce9685e944226bb5a2
(cherry picked from commit e6a368a697e936f40a0882b236b2be17e1520436)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 12:01:08.000000000', 'message': 'Use --numeric-owner when extracting base image

When extracting the base image without --numeric-owner, user and group
names in the tarball are mapped to uid/gid by the host.  This can cause
problems when building an image for some other distro than you're
running yourself.  For example, building an Ubuntu image on openSUSE
ends up with /var/cache/man in the image owned by 'proxy' (uid 13)
instead of 'man' (uid 6), because the host (openSUSE) uses uid 13 for
the 'man' user.  This particular man/proxy discrepancy results in
"fopen: Permission denied" errors when apt-get does its "Processing
triggers for man-db" thing in the Ubuntu system.  I wouldn't be
surprised if there were other kinks caused by this uid/gid mapping
discrepancy too, but that's the one I found so far.

The same thing can also happen with Fedora, but seems to be less likely,
or at least less obvious to me when building Fedora images on openSUSE.
But, IMO, it's better to be safe and just use --numeric-owner on all
base image untarring outside the chroot.

Change-Id: I9da5ac66dd182e7278fe4fee932093f61d35673a
'}]
commit_message:
Use --numeric-owner when extracting base image

When extracting the base image without --numeric-owner, user and group
names in the tarball are mapped to uid/gid by the host.  This can cause
problems when building an image for some other distro than you're
running yourself.  For example, building an Ubuntu image on openSUSE
ends up with /var/cache/man in the image owned by 'proxy' (uid 13)
instead of 'man' (uid 6), because the host (openSUSE) uses uid 13 for
the 'man' user.  This particular man/proxy discrepancy results in
"fopen: Permission denied" errors when apt-get does its "Processing
triggers for man-db" thing in the Ubuntu system.  I wouldn't be
surprised if there were other kinks caused by this uid/gid mapping
discrepancy too, but that's the one I found so far.

The same thing can also happen with Fedora, but seems to be less likely,
or at least less obvious to me when building Fedora images on openSUSE.
But, IMO, it's better to be safe and just use --numeric-owner on all
base image untarring outside the chroot.

Change-Id: I9da5ac66dd182e7278fe4fee932093f61d35673a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 19:31:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix mysql checkout handler AttributeError

If the mysql_on_checkout handler encountered an error due to
disconnect, it would fail with an AttributeError,

 AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'warn'

This is because it used the logging module where the LOG logger
should have been used.

Change-Id: Iae8a9bd4aeee6e35508059c20b92d70c36232963
Closes-Bug: #1234873
(cherry picked from commit d973ea9a47a6f9892208722f69a0cd127b2f73dc)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix mysql checkout handler AttributeError

If the mysql_on_checkout handler encountered an error due to
disconnect, it would fail with an AttributeError,

 AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'warn'

This is because it used the logging module where the LOG logger
should have been used.

Change-Id: Iae8a9bd4aeee6e35508059c20b92d70c36232963
Closes-Bug: #1234873
(cherry picked from commit d973ea9a47a6f9892208722f69a0cd127b2f73dc)

commit_message:
Quota/limit graphs now work in IE

IE has only parital support for html5 dataset. Here proposed solution
accesses the custom attributes via JQuery.

Fixes Bug #1195500

Change-Id: Ie1832db4671f5907d0cb0da50b0bbbd597f1b16d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-07 23:05:40.000000000', 'message': "Update defaults for some compute options

Update the default value of running_deleted_instance_action to 'reap'
from 'log'.  Also update the default value of
resume_guests_state_on_host_boot to True instead of False.  I feel that
these defaults are what most people would expect.  By making the change
early in Icehouse development, we give ourselves a lot of time to deal
with any potential fallout from this change in defaults.

DocImpact

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-October/016153.html

Change-Id: I24990e20c8b85fb8b7ce15c229f99f5b0281f103
"}, {'created': '2013-10-08 13:46:33.000000000', 'message': "Update default for running_deleted_instance_action

Update the default value of running_deleted_instance_action to 'reap'
from 'log'.  Consensus seems to be that this is what most people expect.

DocImpact

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-October/016153.html

Change-Id: I24990e20c8b85fb8b7ce15c229f99f5b0281f103
"}]
commit_message:
Update default for running_deleted_instance_action

Update the default value of running_deleted_instance_action to 'reap'
from 'log'.  Consensus seems to be that this is what most people expect.

DocImpact

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-October/016153.html

Change-Id: I24990e20c8b85fb8b7ce15c229f99f5b0281f103

This is starting to look good. I like seeing that funky code removed. Few minor comments.'}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-09-20 16:55:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

So, I wrote the time simulation code in order to make the fake mode tests run even faster. Originally fake mode would take around 30 or so seconds as the fake code does things such as creating a fake server with a BUILD status which changes to ACTIVE in a second or so. Even though it was only a second that time added up, so simulating time caused things to speed up to around 2 to 4 seconds.

It seems like meanwhile, the code around running the tests takes longer. Plus adding a second suite of tests with TestR slowed things down (not TestR itself but simply invoking multiple things with Tox). So now the speed increase isn't as noticeable. 

These changes do however make the tests take a bit longer- looking at other runs, I see results like this:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44668/
    gate-trove-python26 SUCCESS in 2m 20s
    gate-trove-python27 SUCCESS in 2m 23s

Compare that with the runs generated here, which are:
    gate-trove-python26 SUCCESS in 3m 53s
    gate-trove-python27 SUCCESS in 4m 09s

So, there is a cost. 

As no one has ever liked viewing or having to understand this time simulation featuree I will +1 these changes and leave it to other members of core to decide if the slow down is ok. I do think the new code is much, much nicer and I greatly appreciate Dmitriy taking the time to remove a bunch of nasty old cruft code that was my fault."}, {'account_id': 6156, 'date': '2013-09-20 17:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

very nice Dmitriy!'}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-09-20 17:17:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: No score

The more I think about it, the less I like this approach. I think we're losing an ability to run these tests at lightning speeds to add a bit of clarity. Some of the code clean up could be done without sacrificing the simulated events mode (it could have been made an option).

Thinking about it, one cool thing the simulated events gave us was the ability to run the tests twice, the second time using the XML API, while doing almost no work. That is really cool. We could have also run the tests with additional configurations in the future as well- such as turning off volume support, or maybe turning on Heat support, running it like that, etc, and it wouldn't have added any time to the test runs.

I won't minus this but I feel like I'd be hypocritical if I +1'd it since I think its a good feature and am arguing that way. In the future I may try to add a simulated events mode back as an option, in some way that is more palpable to the people who didn't understand this code. 

I'll let the other core members decide on this."}, {'account_id': 8601, 'date': '2013-09-20 19:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-20 19:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 8601, 'date': '2013-09-24 10:55:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

Tim Simpson, thank you for comments. I agreed with you that tests became slower and it is not good. But Let me describe my point of view.

When I started refactoring I planned to use oslo rpc/impl_fake.py for trove-api and trove-taskmanager communication. As we know now this fake impl makes rpc cast operation blockable (so it works like call operation). This is good for functional testing because after call operation is complete and we don't have to perform waiting like poll_until. But in this case it is necessary to have different tests set for functional and integration tests (I guess it is best way because integratioin tests and functional tests have a different goals: functional tests should check that code works correctly, integration tests should test component interation problems). During discussion about whole trove test system refactoring was decided that we should keep the same behaviour model for functional and integration tests to be able use the same tests for both testing. If we define this as given, any simulation change behaviour of test flow (maybe a bit but change) and use it also can cause some problem)

So my vision is the next: simulation time.sleep makes tests faster but make code more complicated

I we need to make our tests faster the better way is to use original impl_fake with sync cast and refactor our test (separate some integration and functional tests which depends on environment behaviour, change logic of some functional tests and so on)"}, {'account_id': 739, 'date': '2013-09-24 17:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Task manager refactoring done

Manager API class removed and rpc fake impl used now for integration
testing

Change-Id: If20004f1b69e41e8243a3f58eec184f1f457affe
Implements: blueprit trove-task-manager-client-refactoring

commit_message:
Performs hard reboot if libvirt soft reboot raises libvirtError

Currently the libvirt driver will only attempt a hard reboot if a soft
reboot fails and returns False. If a libvirt exception is raised,
however, the hard reboot is not attempted. This patch wraps the soft
reboot in a try block to continue with the hard reboot attempt if a
libvirtError is raised.

Fixes bug 1202974

(cherry picked from commit 9925c9f1b353240ebb1eccde50574055ce271313)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/test_libvirt.py

Change-Id: Ifaff75b33b5123cdd3293e8f263ccb4f72ae726a

commit_message:
Gracefully handle qpid errors

If a qpid error occurs when Glance is sending notifications, the
qpid connection may not be cleaned up properly.  This change catches
qpid exceptions to allow proper error handling.

Fixes bug 1164681

Conflicts:
	glance/tests/unit/test_notifier.py

(cherry picked from commit 1e98e108c057914a1e8b2ee2295c80db410b5ffa)
Change-Id: Ica3ef54b958e4efe3932b90d721324e7860b1ea4

commit_message:
Update some cases of iterating stack resources

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/49879 iterating over a
stack will return resource names instead of resources.

This change updates some cases of iterating on a stack, there
are likely others which remaint to be updated.

Change-Id: I3fff5d7d7fd0016d741151010d0e1ce969da01b3
Partial-Bug: #1236678

commit_message:
Fixes for Active Directory

The LDAP Identity backend was not properly using the
user_enabled_default option as a string. This caused
operations to fail with

 TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for &: 'str' and 'int'

Also, fetching users using the LDAP Identity backend would fail with

 KeyError: 'enabled'

from _ldap_res_to_model when user_enabled_mask is not 0.

Closes-Bug: #1210175
(cherry picked from commit 68f38a65c60485c34474e490d649b328421e10f5)
(cherry picked from commit 116897786dbb8473154ec85a01b019af8106a1f4)
(cherry picked from commit 54178b735dea4dfee4578caa95cb3ae704afef07)
(cherry picked from commit 87ababb38506a1a51b9e38fc343dd3b46c828a80)
(cherry picked from commit 781c65b72b78bd1e2b1d93db029d6b0c6fbc2050)

Change-Id: Ic01aa505d867c1de30e2a1ed7c79ff1478e213ef

commit_message:
Fixes host stats for VMWareVCDriver

Host stats for VCDriver should collect aggregate cluster stats
rather than that of a single host in the cluster.

Fixes: bug #1190515
Change-Id: I37e46995c5da2e3052e8178098afee7c8061bb3c
(cherry picked from commit 92983257bb8e19dff54cc8a2188cc692dcafe5b8)

commit_message:
Always filter out multicast from reflection

Instances will try IPv6 neighbour discovery via multicast
even in an IPv4-only cloud and can throw errors
if they see inbound packets from their own MAC address

Closes-bug: #1229625

Change-Id: I3539e788fe07519d87ce7c3800c5d38b7bd99d3b

commit_message:
Add a custom iboot power driver for nova bm.

Adds a custom power driver for nova baremetal so that
iBoot capable devices can be used.

In order to support multiple baremetal nodes attached to a single PDU
you can specify a pm_address in the format of address:port,relay.
If only an address is specified port and relay use defaults.

Tested locally with an iBoot G2.

Fixes bug 1226042
Implements nova-barmetal-iboot-g2-driver

Change-Id: I155f364f4ff6d77b34ded46de60c5cbca26596a2

commit_message:
Drop unused BM start_console/stop_console methods.

We already implement these function (which return/pass) in
the base PowerManager.

Change-Id: Ib85cc9054f1256d768669fca179bb3532b785201

commit_message:
Ensure that the netaddr import is in the 3rd party section

There were cases when the netaddr import was not in the correct place.

Change-Id: I7715fcfa8cade6a78a2a58dffdc9cdca13b7d59c
Closes-Bug: #1236744

commit_message:
Remove `utils.total_seconds`

The one place this was used would be better written using
`timeutils.delta_seconds`.

Change-Id: I601c23245149ca1bd9bbf5927a2458a6a1c21dbe

[{'created': '2013-09-27 06:04:19.000000000', 'message': 'Use the rdo havana repo with the RHEL family

In devstack viewpoint there is not too much differences at the moment.
But using the grizzly named repo close to havana release, was strange to me.

Change-Id: Ib421d50d19baeeeff264aa0cb9c105fffcf572f8
'}, {'created': '2013-09-28 09:43:29.000000000', 'message': "Use the rdo havana repo with the RHEL family

In devstack viewpoint there is not too much differences at the moment.
But using the grizzly named repo close to havana release, was strange to me.

Switching to the repo link which does not have a version like '-3'.

Change-Id: Ib421d50d19baeeeff264aa0cb9c105fffcf572f8
"}]
commit_message:
Use the rdo havana repo with the RHEL family

In devstack viewpoint there is not too much differences at the moment.
But using the grizzly named repo close to havana release, was strange to me.

Switching to the repo link which does not have a version like '-3'.

Change-Id: Ib421d50d19baeeeff264aa0cb9c105fffcf572f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-23 17:09:27.000000000', 'message': "Two small account-quota fixes

First: even if a user has exceeded their account quota, they should be
able to make object POST requests. Updating an object's metadata isn't
going to make them any more over quota, so should be allowed.

Second: don't bother with the reseller_admin check for container or
object requests. If I send the header X-Account-Meta-Quota-Bytes: 100
on e.g. an object PUT request, the proxy will (rightly) ignore it. Now
account-quotas does too.

Change-Id: I970a76349659acdd8229a324bd33bfe7fe7261a4
"}]
commit_message:
Two small account-quota fixes

First: even if a user has exceeded their account quota, they should be
able to make object POST requests. Updating an object's metadata isn't
going to make them any more over quota, so should be allowed.

Second: don't bother with the reseller_admin check for container or
object requests. If I send the header X-Account-Meta-Quota-Bytes: 100
on e.g. an object PUT request, the proxy will (rightly) ignore it. Now
account-quotas does too.

Change-Id: I970a76349659acdd8229a324bd33bfe7fe7261a4

[{'created': '2013-10-08 09:26:35.000000000', 'message': "Replace decprecated method 'failIf' in tests

Some of the TestCase methods have been deprecated since python 2.7.
We need use correct names.

http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

* replace 'failIf' with 'assertFalse'

Change-Id: I68746f8810c17cd5456328005fc65003e57491c8
"}, {'created': '2013-10-08 09:31:12.000000000', 'message': "Replace decprecated method aliases in tests

Some of the TestCase methods have been deprecated since python 2.7.
We need use correct names.

http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

* replace 'failIf' with 'assertFalse'
* replace 'failUnlessAlmostEqual' with 'assertAlmostEqual'

Change-Id: I68746f8810c17cd5456328005fc65003e57491c8
"}]
commit_message:
Replace decprecated method aliases in tests

Some of the TestCase methods have been deprecated since python 2.7.
We need use correct names.

http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

* replace 'failIf' with 'assertFalse'
* replace 'failUnlessAlmostEqual' with 'assertAlmostEqual'

Change-Id: I68746f8810c17cd5456328005fc65003e57491c8

commit_message:
Extract generic part of GA code from MySQL specific modules

Extract common part of MySqlAppStatus to superclass
in order to provide easier implementation of
other DB engines support

Blueprint: refactor-ga-for-other-engines-support

Change-Id: Id101cccb0181055153ad817c12b1056e989b598d

Change-Id: If93a5ac6d5833ecca197870109641722719e7b41
"}]
commit_message:
Always fail if images are not available

Remove strictImageValidation = False from pom.xml files so that
builds will fail if images are not available.
The books are fine now, there are no problems. So, let's not
silently get new failures in.

Change-Id: If93a5ac6d5833ecca197870109641722719e7b41

commit_message:
Update the test environment on each loop.

setup-env calls pull-tools, which we need to ensure we're running the
latest code.

Change-Id: I07d767937fbb339e7a98c62bb545962101b8f27b

Previously, only True and False were supported. Havana changed to
allows an administrator to specify which images should reject
any user requests for auto config.

Change-Id: I32a09ce1258893388d31ca2c1704e57d23ceff97
Closes-Bug: 1214816
'}, {'created': '2013-10-08 05:33:33.000000000', 'message': 'doc xen support for auto_disk_config=disabled

Previously, only True and False were supported. Havana changed to
allows an administrator to specify which images should reject
any user requests for auto config.

Also fix an incorrect statement that auto_disk_config was a nova.conf
variable - it is instead a property set on an image in glance.

Change-Id: I32a09ce1258893388d31ca2c1704e57d23ceff97
Closes-Bug: 1214816
'}]
commit_message:
doc xen support for auto_disk_config=disabled

Previously, only True and False were supported. Havana changed to
allows an administrator to specify which images should reject
any user requests for auto config.

Also fix an incorrect statement that auto_disk_config was a nova.conf
variable - it is instead a property set on an image in glance.

Change-Id: I32a09ce1258893388d31ca2c1704e57d23ceff97
Closes-Bug: 1214816

commit_message:
Document what used_now and used_max mean

The "nova host-describe" documentation in the user-guide
doesn't currently explain what used_now and used_max mean.
This commit adds a short explanation of each one to help
users understand the difference between the two values.

Fixes bug 1236430

Change-Id: Id6ab2ddbd0d21b1cd34881d3881d620dc5e060a7

commit_message:
Apache is the foundation. Apache http server is the product.
Also, start instructions for RH platforms where it's called
httpd rather than apache2.

Change-Id: Icf1a66541fb2e6740ac36758955c112c644a009d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 15:01:12.000000000', 'message': 'Enable Quota DB driver by default

Closes-Bug: #1189671

Quota driver is now loaded in lazy mode, i.e. the driver is loaded
the first time the driver is accessed. This is to make unit tests
work. Some unit tests like extension test cases need to use Config
Quota driver (previous default) but QuotaEngine is initialized
when quota.py is imported. Thus the unit tests had no chance to
specify quota_driver.

Change-Id: I9e20961d5a6322361e3c0284b3c2a7ca86755c70
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Quota DB driver by default

Closes-Bug: #1189671

Quota driver is now loaded in lazy mode, i.e. the driver is loaded
the first time the driver is accessed. This is to make unit tests
work. Some unit tests like extension test cases need to use Config
Quota driver (previous default) but QuotaEngine is initialized
when quota.py is imported. Thus the unit tests had no chance to
specify quota_driver.

Change-Id: I9e20961d5a6322361e3c0284b3c2a7ca86755c70

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 15:19:42.000000000', 'message': "Avoid race with udev during ovs agent startup

After taking down the veth link between the physical bridge and the integration
bridge call udevadm settle to wait for any udev events to be completely
processed by the operating system before recreating the veth pair.

Some distributions (e.g. openSUSE) have udev rules installed by default that
call e.g. ifdown <interface> during the remove event. If that is processed
after the ovs agent already brought up the veth pair again the veth pair's
link will be down after the agent completed startup and networking will be
broken for all VM instances.

Change-Id: I95520ea96a9804c5261a0c994bbca137535cc37c
Closes-Bug: #1218556
(cherry picked from commit 8d88ee7411d43f148b45d0a145fe32a75765a3ac)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid race with udev during ovs agent startup

After taking down the veth link between the physical bridge and the integration
bridge call udevadm settle to wait for any udev events to be completely
processed by the operating system before recreating the veth pair.

Some distributions (e.g. openSUSE) have udev rules installed by default that
call e.g. ifdown <interface> during the remove event. If that is processed
after the ovs agent already brought up the veth pair again the veth pair's
link will be down after the agent completed startup and networking will be
broken for all VM instances.

Change-Id: I95520ea96a9804c5261a0c994bbca137535cc37c
Closes-Bug: #1218556
(cherry picked from commit 8d88ee7411d43f148b45d0a145fe32a75765a3ac)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 17:45:59.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent L3 agent looping calls from hanging

This patch adopts several measures to prevent _sync_routers_task
and _rpc_loop from hanging because of subprocess.Popen.communicate
not returning.

1) Perform a sleep everytime a command is completed, similarly to
what is done in openstack.common.processutils.execute
2) Disable by default GARP, as kernel crashes caused by arping
have been observed
3) Prevent a non-critical keyerror in _router_removed from triggering
again a full sync, which might put the system under significant load.

This patch also adds debug log statements aimed at improving the
ability of debugging similar failures.

Change-Id: I003316bce0f38b7d2ea7d563b5a0a58676834398
Partial-Bug: 1224001
(cherry picked from commit 591ee00a67fbbe5f106ba12140b9f9420dee5907)
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent L3 agent looping calls from hanging

This patch adopts several measures to prevent _sync_routers_task
and _rpc_loop from hanging because of subprocess.Popen.communicate
not returning.

1) Perform a sleep everytime a command is completed, similarly to
what is done in openstack.common.processutils.execute
2) Disable by default GARP, as kernel crashes caused by arping
have been observed
3) Prevent a non-critical keyerror in _router_removed from triggering
again a full sync, which might put the system under significant load.

This patch also adds debug log statements aimed at improving the
ability of debugging similar failures.

Change-Id: I003316bce0f38b7d2ea7d563b5a0a58676834398
Partial-Bug: 1224001
(cherry picked from commit 591ee00a67fbbe5f106ba12140b9f9420dee5907)

commit_message:
Update conf option tables for cinder

This re-runs the autodoc tool to generate new flagmappings for
cinder from the recent trunk. It starts to separate out
the 'storage' category into various driver components.

Change-Id: Iaa8770001fcb182403ce9f1b756d4732d06bc3f6

Designate doesn't needs those parameters. This review is for DNS refactoring. Designate has it's own support in Trove."}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-09-25 19:38:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Do not merge

(4 inline comments)

There was an interface in place where drivers could be swapped out. I'm not sure why this interface had to be completely changed for Designate support."}, {'account_id': 8415, 'date': '2013-09-25 20:00:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: (4 inline comments)

Tim, please take a look at blueprint dependencies. And you will see, that your solution wont work in future terms. So, i'd like you to go deeper and understand whole workflow of DNS with Designate and Floating IPs support on pre-provisioning step."}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-09-26 15:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Hi Dennis,

I've been looking at your Blueprints but its taking me awhile to read them. I also don't understand some of the comments, such as "Trove should use dns recording via novaclient with direct association with instance at pre-provisioning". 

"pre-provisioning" implies that the DNS code would be moved to right before the Nova server is created. However, this code doesn't move the DNS code there, so I'm not certain how related it is.

Additionally the other blueprint discusses the need for a "dns driver api interface" which already exists in the code.'}, {'account_id': 8415, 'date': '2013-09-26 16:24:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 8415, 'date': '2013-09-26 16:31:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Hi, Tim. I know that BPs are not updated. By telling that we need create DNS records via novaclient 'cuz it could do that, but nova, itself, rejects any attempts to add any DNS servers support in it.
So, current idea is to add Designate support, i'm on my way to it.
Last patch is perfect for Designate integration."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-26 16:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Works for me

commit_message:
Update statuses on GA timeout

Updates instance status if GA stacks at BUILD status
after poll_until
Change-Id: I062e6694ce326e20f7a8c1e85c3e374713f0b0f6
Implements: blueprint update-instance-task-status-if-instance-stucks-at-build-status-to-error

commit_message:
Fix mysql checkout handler AttributeError

If the mysql_on_checkout handler encountered an error due to
disconnect, it would fail with an AttributeError,

 AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'warn'

This is because it used the logging module where the LOG logger
should have been used.

Change-Id: Iae8a9bd4aeee6e35508059c20b92d70c36232963
Closes-Bug: #1234873

commit_message:
py33: sort the files parameters of "--files"

In Python 3.3, hash randomization is enabled by default. It causes the
iteration order of dicts and sets to be unpredictable and differ across
Python runs.

Sort the files parameters when multiple files are designated.

Close-Bug #1235096

Change-Id: I0db645b3fb92408bd8c6780bfabe7ce8265a65a8

commit_message:
Support Optional Super User in Instance Create

The creation of initial users and/or databases is supported in an
instance-create request, but the creation of a super/root user is
not. Granted, it's possible to create or reset the root user, but it
must be done as a separate request, after the instance has completely
initialized.

Changeset: If CONF.root_on_create == True, a UUID is generated for
the root user's password and is returned in the instance-create
response as the "password" property/field.

Change-Id: I300d3f019766445b90411d5ab8651b1aa34a77e9
Implements: blueprint instance-initial-super-user
Closes-Bug: #1219624

commit_message:
Conditionally set my_ip

local-ipv4 isn't set on the seed vm, causing nova-api to fail to start.

Change-Id: I5a321649b0258bda22c1f257adcb1781d2319df8

[{'created': '2013-08-14 15:13:53.000000000', 'message': "Add ability to do smart backwards compat testing

Normally, devstack-gate will check out the zuul changes for all of the
projects in the queue ahead of it. In the case where we're testing
a change to master of a client lib against the stable branches, we do
not want to pick up changes for master branches for a project with a
stable branch that happens to be ahead of it in the queue.

To that end, introduce a flag variable to enable the logic shift. When
the flag is set, ignore zuul refs for branches that have stable
branches (or, more specifically, for branches that match the requested
branch)

Change-Id: I521475e67a0fe259a057aef310423f665573e3ea

commit_message:
Add ability to do smart backwards compat testing

Normally, devstack-gate will check out the zuul changes for all of the
projects in the queue ahead of it. In the case where we're testing
a change to master of a client lib against the stable branches, we want
to pick up changes ahead of this change in the queue if they are changes
that correspond to the requested backwards override branch we're testing
against.

To that end, introduce a variable to indicate which branch, other than
"the one that matches the branch of the current change" we would like to
test against. If that is set, override the branches for all other
associated projects, but ensure that we do pick up changes that are
enqueued ahead of it that are for that branch.

Change-Id: I521475e67a0fe259a057aef310423f665573e3ea

I don't think this is the way to go for name lookups. I'd prefer a utility function which checks network_id properties for UUIDness and does a name to uuid lookup.  I think neutronclient has convenience methods to lookup a resource by name too.

Even though all the neutron resource reference properties have *_id in their name, I think it would be acceptable to allow names on those properties too - as long as what is possible is clearly documented."}, {'account_id': 6917, 'date': '2013-10-08 14:15:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Steven Dake,

I agree with Steve Baker. Neutron client has a static function called find_resourceid_by_name_or_id. This function is already used in heat code to create router gateway. You can check handle_create method for RouterGateway in heat/engine/resources/neutron/router.py."}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-10-08 18:36:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

abandoning after reviews.  thanks for the reviews folks.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-06 13:48:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add a OS::Neutron::NetRefByName resource

In order for Neutron to be usable it must sometimes operate in
existing network environments. Resources such as OS::Nova::Server
take a networks property which allows the connection of Neutron
networks to a virtual machine. Unfortunately there is no way to
connect to existing networks that may be dictated by cloud providers.

Implement a OS::Neutron::NetRefByName resource which does not
create or delete resources, but only references them by name and
allows the use of the "Ref" keyword in templates without having to
guess the UUID or change it between network config changes. This must
naturally be a new resource, because it doesn't actually create or
destroy the network during its operation.

Change-Id: I1fa9f1f7285633e712db9e0d1c0b07aceed57e11
'}]
commit_message:
Add a OS::Neutron::NetRefByName resource

In order for Neutron to be usable it must sometimes operate in
existing network environments. Resources such as OS::Nova::Server
take a networks property which allows the connection of Neutron
networks to a virtual machine. Unfortunately there is no way to
connect to existing networks that may be dictated by cloud providers.

Implement a OS::Neutron::NetRefByName resource which does not
create or delete resources, but only references them by name and
allows the use of the "Ref" keyword in templates without having to
guess the UUID or change it between network config changes. This must
naturally be a new resource, because it doesn't actually create or
destroy the network during its operation.

Change-Id: I1fa9f1f7285633e712db9e0d1c0b07aceed57e11

commit_message:
meta should be metadata in rebuild server

this change the parameter of rebuild server from  meta to metadata.
currently the parameter meta has been ignored.

Closes-Bug: #1233040

Change-Id: I9009a8836e07496f5752956c28ee7d9b0b0e783e

subject: Add `versionutils` for version compatibility checks
messages:
[{'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-10-07 22:16:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-10-07 22:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-07 22:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-oslo-incubator-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/82/50182/2/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/1161da3 : SUCCESS in 1m 58s
- gate-oslo-incubator-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/82/50182/2/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/034a5f0/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 06s
- gate-oslo-incubator-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/82/50182/2/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/abf16f1 : SUCCESS in 2m 49s
- gate-oslo-incubator-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/82/50182/2/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/3883c79 : SUCCESS in 3m 15s
'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-10-07 22:24:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Did you investigate distutils.versions or pkg_resources.parse_version as alternatives to creating something new?'}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-10-07 22:29:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-10-07 22:41:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It looks like the distutils code is undocumented, but pkg_resources.parse_version() is documented at http://pythonhosted.org/distribute/pkg_resources.html#parsing-utilities"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-10-07 22:44:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

distlib.version has nice objects that know how to compare themselves to each other: http://distlib.readthedocs.org/en/latest/tutorial.html#using-the-version-api'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-10-07 22:46:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

>>> import pkg_resources
pkg_resources.par>>> pkg_resources.parse_version('2.10')
('00000002', '00000010', '*final')
>>> pkg_resources.parse_version('2.9')
('00000002', '00000009', '*final')
>>> pkg_resources.parse_version('2.9') < pkg_resources.parse_version('2.10')
True
>>>"}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-10-07 23:09:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

Doug:

Thanks for pointing out those two other options. I definitely don't want to unnecessarily reinvent the wheel here!

If either of these options trivially handle the use-cases listed, then I think we should probably just use them instead.

If they partially handle the use-cases, then maybe it would be best to use the `is_compatible` API since it matches nicely to how we actually do version checks, but then maybe under the hood implement it with pkg_resources or distutils so we get all the weird corner cases around 'beta', 'rc1', etc handled."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-10-08 12:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

Rick,

It looks like pkg_resources is probably the best approach because distlib is still "experimental" and distutils.versions is undocumented. I've added a couple of inline comments about how I think it would work, keeping is_compatible() as a wrapper. 

If the special major version check logic is not widely used, then we may not need the wrapper. What's the use case for that?'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-10-08 14:43:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Doug:

Thanks for the research here, really helpful!

As to the major-version logic, at least in Nova, it's the common-case; 2), 3), and 4) above use it. Only the Nova agent tolerates a major version difference between client and server (perhaps this is actually a bug? probably should ask comstud).

Assuming the `pkg_resources` swap passes the test-cases (and maybe a few more related to 1)'s own cmp_version code, then I think we should be good-to-go."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2013-10-08 15:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-08 15:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Add `versionutils` for version compatibility checks

There are a number of different version compatibility checks performed across
OpenStack projects, with Nova alone having at least four within it:

    1) Nova agent version check

    2) XenAPI Dom0 plugin version check

    3) RPC API version check

    4) Nova object version check

Despite similarities between all of these checks, each case chooses to
implement its own.

This patch provides a mechanism for standardizing the version checking process
by providing a single, well-tested function, `is_compatible` that the four
cases listed above (and others) can use instead.

Change-Id: Icc5ff6b7f3914df60f78b9a14806413a063dac0f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-07 21:13:49.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup existing instances in setup for test_list_servers_negative.py

Change I8519cba1fcf6ff39d69839783d07359544509db5 was supposed to make
the setup for test_list_servers_negative.py handle the case that tempest
is being ran without tenant isolation, but it doesn't fix the entire
problem because it's only checking if the MULTI_USER global is False.
The MULTI_USER global is only False if allow_tenant_isolation=False and
user1 == user2. So if you're running tempest without tenant isolation
but you do have two separate users/tenants for running the tests, then
the setup can still fail.

This patch fixes the problem by always doing the cleanup if
allow_tenant_isolation=False regardless of what MULTI_USER is set to.

Closes-Bug: #1234370

Change-Id: I821e200d07c11ba04d8be788095b7648de1d820b
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup existing instances in setup for test_list_servers_negative.py

Change I8519cba1fcf6ff39d69839783d07359544509db5 was supposed to make
the setup for test_list_servers_negative.py handle the case that tempest
is being ran without tenant isolation, but it doesn't fix the entire
problem because it's only checking if the MULTI_USER global is False.
The MULTI_USER global is only False if allow_tenant_isolation=False and
user1 == user2. So if you're running tempest without tenant isolation
but you do have two separate users/tenants for running the tests, then
the setup can still fail.

This patch fixes the problem by always doing the cleanup if
allow_tenant_isolation=False regardless of what MULTI_USER is set to.

Closes-Bug: #1234370

Change-Id: I821e200d07c11ba04d8be788095b7648de1d820b

commit_message:
Log names of drivers being loaded

This is a small change to include the names of the transport and
storage drivers loaded in the bootstrap. This is useful to ensure
that the correct config file is being referenced.

Change-Id: I3a51b279379ea702d1ff4bf7983e183c97b06e77

commit_message:
Prevent L3 agent looping calls from hanging

This patch adopts several measures to prevent _sync_routers_task
and _rpc_loop from hanging because of subprocess.Popen.communicate
not returning.

1) Perform a sleep everytime a command is completed, similarly to
what is done in openstack.common.processutils.execute
2) Disable by default GARP, as kernel crashes caused by arping
have been observed
3) Prevent a non-critical keyerror in _router_removed from triggering
again a full sync, which might put the system under significant load.

This patch also adds debug log statements aimed at improving the
ability of debugging similar failures.

Change-Id: I003316bce0f38b7d2ea7d563b5a0a58676834398
Partial-Bug: 1224001

commit_message:
change port status only if port is bound to the good host

if host is set in the rpc message update_device_up/down sent by the agent,
the port status will be changed only if the port is bound to the host.

Change-Id: I0e607c734fbebf0b69f83c3bbd3e25a9783672dc
Closes-Bug: #1224967

commit_message:
Mount /dev/pts in chroot

Mounting /dev/pts fixes mildly irritating errors during image creation,
i.e.: "Can not write log, openpty() failed (/dev/pts not mounted?)"
emitted by apt-get.

Change-Id: I4106bc584f1b29ce9283a20064bb5ae447f17fbe

commit_message:
Fix priorities selection for non-storage roles
* fix typo, which in some cases seted wrong priority
* add tests for priorities selection

Change-Id: Id76386935b20640531aff431c3816ca3ca7c1839

- gate-grenade-devstack-vm http://logs.openstack.org/20/42920/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/12ac88c : SUCCESS in 1h 19m 08s
'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-08-21 04:58:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I think it very good approach for starting a system independent tempest configuration script.

I see an issue with mixing the credentials given as argument and the ones which already exported.

In the script the OpenStack commands does not use any credentials arguments, it means they are using the environment variables.

If the script gets authentication related parameters, it should export those for CLI usage. Otherwise the CLI commands needs to specify these parameters always.

In case of some function needs a different environment variable the function can use the () brackets instead of {}, or a new namespace can be created by ( )  anywhere.

In every test system exporting the admin credentials is solvable before the script.

But if someone prefers the arguments, it should overwrite the already exported credentials."}, {'account_id': 6578, 'date': '2013-08-21 09:29:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6578, 'date': '2013-08-21 09:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (8 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6578, 'date': '2013-08-21 09:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

afazekas, forgot to mention, regarding the environment variables, in order to overwrite the shell env vars, you need to `source` the script, `export` just adds it to the sub-shells, thus it is not sufficient.
I will update the assumptions comment about this once more people review the script as submitting a new patch for just one comment seem an overkill :)'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-08-21 10:09:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

If you export a variable outside to a '()' and not on the right side on a pipe it will be visible to all child process, created after the export as a new child.

If you do it in a ()  or right side of the pipe it will be only visible to those processes and to their child.

The 'source' does almost the same as the ``sourced`` text file (shell script) would be in the place of the source built-in command."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-08-21 10:12:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I am read only, I commented a wrong change set, with detracted message. Sorry about that..'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-21 11:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

    2. maybe you should unify the naming choice between uri/url across the options and variables'}, {'account_id': 6578, 'date': '2013-08-27 16:49:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Joe, initially, I thought there will be many bash commands (not for this basic code, but more for future implementation), so I started with bash, no real reason not to do this in python, this is actually why I pushed it at this early stage of writing it, to get some feedback on how to continue :)

Giulio,
1. As far as I know, I can manage with one image ref as I can spawn multiple instances from it.. or did you mean something else?
2. Agreed, probably missed that during my first check :)'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-08-27 19:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Initial basic setup of openstack and tempest config file

The objective of this script is to configure openstack environment +
tempest config file while relying on nothing but the current Openstack
installation and/or existing tempest config file.
it achieves this by using only Openstack python clients and/or global Openstack
environment variables and for some tempest specific settings, the tempest
config file.
This script is a WIP and currently support only creating users and configure
the tempest config file with active images found in openstack.

TODO:
    1. Add support for existing config and not rely on sample only
    2. Add download & creation of images
    3. Add network configuration
    4. more advance features as required

Change-Id: I06f38280e6b550d03c64954e042aee7331ecb31b

commit_message:
VMware: Re-create session for RetrievePropertiesEx

When RetrievePropertiesEx API is called after session timeout, the driver
does not re-create session automatically.

This is a regression caused when moving from RetrieveProperties to
RetrievePropertiesEx API.

Fixes bug: 1235187

Change-Id: I8a1e2452dfb3029365d59eae7850d1a9363b25f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-07 14:58:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix broken solidfire create-snapshot

A previous change to enable secifying size for cloned volumes
created introduced a bug that breaks the ability to create-snapshots
when using the SolidFire driver
(CID: I5628c7fa922780d6b0601e2daa79310a61085edc).

The problem is that we use a shared method in the SF driver for both
create-clone and create-snapshot, the added change only considers the
clone case and does a get ref['size'] but in the case of snapshots
this needs to be ref['volume_size'].

Closes-Bug: 1234970

Change-Id: I50603b3ac43f2c3c7e7811ec34de078a268519f7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix broken solidfire create-snapshot

A previous change to enable secifying size for cloned volumes
created introduced a bug that breaks the ability to create-snapshots
when using the SolidFire driver
(CID: I5628c7fa922780d6b0601e2daa79310a61085edc).

The problem is that we use a shared method in the SF driver for both
create-clone and create-snapshot, the added change only considers the
clone case and does a get ref['size'] but in the case of snapshots
this needs to be ref['volume_size'].

Closes-Bug: 1234970

Change-Id: I50603b3ac43f2c3c7e7811ec34de078a268519f7

commit_message:
Improvement for glance cache to be automaticly configured

1. Remove glance cache size option from ui and editable cluster attrs.
2. Calculate glance cache size based on formula:
   10%*(/var/lib/glance) if > 5GB else 5GB
3. Tests for new functional
Change-Id: Ibee9b9717fefa5ab7f12b012aa6770317728f890

commit_message:
fix(mongo): Queue listing may include queues from other projects

This patch changes the mongo driver so that it explicitly checks that the
queue belongs to the correct project, rather than simply getting
everything greater than a specific queue name.

The associated unit test was updated to catch any regressions in the
fix. The test was also updated to take into account the change in queue
metadata handling that landed several weeks ago.

Change-Id: I6434d8452ff38bb3191ab947f5f143b650e2b103
Closes-Bug: #1236605

commit_message:
Disassociate floating IPs from port on terminate

Bugfix - floating IPs were left associated after VM
was terminated. Now call disassociate_floatingips
within delete_port as in other networking plugins.

Add L3NatDBIntTestCase suite to cover the
floating IP disassociation case, and fix all failing
tests from that suite.

Change-Id: I856c46631e495d513065fc9e987898408441a21e
Closes-Bug: #1231913

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-07 06:01:53.000000000', 'message': 'Enable Quota DB driver by default

Closes-Bug: #1189671

In unit tests which need to use quota ConfDriver, QuotaEngine is
reinitialized in setUp() to ensure ConfDriver is used.
QuotaEngine is initialized when quota.py is imported. This means
that there is no chance to each test to specify a quota driver
without reinitializing QuotaEngine.

Change-Id: I9e20961d5a6322361e3c0284b3c2a7ca86755c70
'}, {'created': '2013-10-07 06:57:16.000000000', 'message': 'Enable Quota DB driver by default

Closes-Bug: #1189671

Quota driver is now loaded in lazy mode, i.e. the driver is loaded
the first time the driver is accessed. This is to make unit tests
work. Some unit tests like extension test cases need to use Config
Quota driver (previous default) but QuotaEngine is initialized
when quota.py is imported. Thus the unit tests had no chance to
specify quota_driver.

Change-Id: I9e20961d5a6322361e3c0284b3c2a7ca86755c70
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Quota DB driver by default

Closes-Bug: #1189671

Quota driver is now loaded in lazy mode, i.e. the driver is loaded
the first time the driver is accessed. This is to make unit tests
work. Some unit tests like extension test cases need to use Config
Quota driver (previous default) but QuotaEngine is initialized
when quota.py is imported. Thus the unit tests had no chance to
specify quota_driver.

Change-Id: I9e20961d5a6322361e3c0284b3c2a7ca86755c70

commit_message:
XenAPI: Get the management network dynamically

xenbr0 is correct for most installations, but not all.  Notable xenserver-core
may use a differently named device.  Since we can auto detect this, remove the
config and do so.

Change-Id: I989f6ddd5ffb526ab350f263ef6fc402c596304a

commit_message:
install_pip script fails if pip was not installed

'set -o errexit' recently added to the pip installer script, which causes
the script fail when it does not able to find an already installed pip.

This change handles the situation when pip is not installed.

Change-Id: I18a42d13c4be6699db21ec5b6a095a88a199912d
