revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 09:21:54.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from ">/dev/stderr" to ">&2"

Although the two should be equivalent (have the same effects) the way
they work is different. The ">/dev/stderr" does an open(), it goes
to the filesystem look for that file, opens it and write to it, it's
also subject to permission checks. The second way of doing it ">&2"
just uses file description 2 so it doesn't hit the filesystem at all,
which would be safer and can't fail at permissions checks.

Change-Id: If9b0cb8dbeee4d29ba1387ba6f62a27223b409a1
Closes-Bug: #1236756
'}, {'created': '2013-10-08 11:22:01.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from ">/dev/stderr" to ">&2"

Although the two should be equivalent (have the same effects) the way
they work is different. The ">/dev/stderr" does an open(), it goes
to the filesystem look for that file, opens it and write to it, it's
also subject to permission checks. The second way of doing it ">&2"
just uses file descriptor 2 so it doesn't hit the filesystem at all,
which would be safer and can't fail at permissions checks.

Change-Id: If9b0cb8dbeee4d29ba1387ba6f62a27223b409a1
Closes-Bug: #1236756
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from ">/dev/stderr" to ">&2"

Although the two should be equivalent (have the same effects) the way
they work is different. The ">/dev/stderr" does an open(), it goes
to the filesystem look for that file, opens it and write to it, it's
also subject to permission checks. The second way of doing it ">&2"
just uses file descriptor 2 so it doesn't hit the filesystem at all,
which would be safer and can't fail at permissions checks.

Change-Id: If9b0cb8dbeee4d29ba1387ba6f62a27223b409a1
Closes-Bug: #1236756

and features that falcon introduced since the 0.1.7 release.

More details can be found below:

commit_message:
reqs: update falcon to 0.1.7

This is needed by the marconi project to take advantage of the fixes
and features that falcon introduced since the 0.1.7 release.

More details can be found below:
- https://github.com/racker/falcon/blob/master/CHANGES.md

Change-Id: I0132fc46920083d73a324b00996563dffcdae248

commit_message:
Allow _status_timeout to be used for non-nova polling

The error status and not-found exception used for
status_timeout and delete_timeout are specific to nova.

This change makes it possible to override the nova defaults.
Specifically, this will improve the status polling of the
orchestration scenario tests.

Change-Id: Ib55f95ed51ecce3813a57c330e0f936414ec3ff2

commit_message:
remove code duplication in tempest/config.py

tempest/config.py has many simliar tiny functions for register_*_opts.
We should remove the code duplication to providing a common function.

Change-Id: Ie8facc21a2d8a1e27687b1182a3db9f98bc1a05e
Closes-Bug: #1236498

commit_message:
Adding two more options to verification_tests options

Adding no_compute_sanity and no_compute_smoke options to
rally/benchmark/tests.py:verification. Each option is analogue of
standart option but skipping tests that will fail if compute section
in Cloud_config is not specified

Fixing testing not working properly on current pytest version.

Change-Id: I76cdfd6a0dc8debcd2a6f1db3506a6f137e78869
Closes-bug: #1236552

commit_message:
Restructured Install Guide

Full outline finished. Keystone, Glance, and most of Nova complete

Changes to Common:
* Separate "Getting Started" content into separate files, so they can be
included individually where needed in the install guide
* separated "Keystone Concepts" so that a smaller subset of that can be
used in the install guide

Change-Id: I583349443685e3022f4c4c1893c2c07d1d2af1d5

I tried adding a test to this, by doing (in nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py):

try:
    self.test_attach_interface()
except AttributeError:
    #\xa0Failure

But the driver is a FakeDriver, so I never get to call the attach_interface() method defined in nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py. Any idea how I could write the test ?



Also, this does not completely fix #1224462: it just fixes the AttributeError issue. revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-13 10:21:55.000000000', 'message': 'nova/compute/manager.py: fix function call

In nova/compute/manager.py, attach_interface() does the following call:

    self.driver.attach_interface(instance, image_meta, network_info[0])

But attach_interface() takes a list as its third argument, not a single
element.  This patch fixes this by passing a one element list instead, as is
done in detach_interface().

Change-Id: Ic38a5072287be68fbc818dc560296da9c6f53067
Closes-Bug: #1224462
'}, {'created': '2013-09-13 19:56:21.000000000', 'message': 'nova/compute/manager.py: fix function call

commit_message:
virt: Fix calls to attach_interface()

Make sure attach_interface always takes a list as its third argument. In order
to make this clearer, rename attach_interface to attach_interfaces and
detach_interface to detach_interfaces.

Closes-Bug: #1224462

Change-Id: Ic38a5072287be68fbc818dc560296da9c6f53067

'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-09-24 03:05:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

access.AccessInfo is what was returned from the server in terms of your token and the permissions that were set from the token. 

I'm not sure that the parameters you request the token with should live on that - and in the event that they do they shouldn't be mixed in with the token response data."}, {'account_id': 6917, 'date': '2013-09-24 11:41:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Jamie. Thank you for your feedback. I'm not a native keystone guy and I do not want to argue. Do you have any proposition how to fix that problem?"}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-09-25 03:02:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I have no problem with it being added to the __init__ parameters (though we are trying to work on reducing those). 
I realize it may need to be added to the authenticate command as well for setting the management_url. 
But unless it is something that is returned from the server side it shouldn't go into accessinfo. 

I do see why it would be good to have it so that it could be used to recreate a client, but this is false in the same way that we don't store the password into AuthInfo, it isn't a seialization of the client - just the auth data.

This situation should improve with the APIClient work because it will separate the act of authenticating (which doesn't require a region) with actually using the returned data which can/will be endpoint appropriate. 

For now i suggest we put it into the __init__ params and use it when setting the management_url."}, {'account_id': 6917, 'date': '2013-09-25 11:34:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thank you for response.

The keypoint point of this patch is to be able to pass provided region name to service_catalog. Service catalog is a part of the AccessInfo and it takes region name as parameter in constructor:

AccessInfo
...
self.service_catalog = service_catalog.ServiceCatalog.factory(resource_dict=self, region_name=self.get('region_name'))
...

Other projects (ie. heat) use url_for method from service_catalog to get appropriate endpoint for given service type. They do not want to use attr filter to endpoint from specific region becuase this feature maybe helpfull for different filtering.

AccessInfo uses also url_for method so if we will pass region name to service catalog it will be used to get approprite management url.

So to sum up it looks okay for me as it is. I also agree with that we should not update input returned by the server but in this situation I think we can make an exception."}, {'account_id': 6917, 'date': '2013-09-25 20:01:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Rebased'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-09-25 20:01:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-25 20:56:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
VMware: Network fallback in case specified one not found

In the case that opqaue network does not match the bridge ID then
we will fall back on a predefined network (configurable by the admin
via 'integration_bridge' in the 'vmware' section).

Fixes bug 1225002

Change-Id: Icfe2cb40feada33e5d86e669e1c88f2ce0dd1c5d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 11:58:41.000000000', 'message': "Field 'deployment_tags' for tests and test_sets alongside with migration to
support these changes were added. To fabfile task that performs creation
of new alembic migration was added. Additional refactoring and non-major
fixes.

cluster_id field was added for test_sets (migration script was
supplied). Logic of discovering test_sets and tests was moved to
controllers (test-set controller). Nose plugin was refactored. Tests was not be
supplied for new features.

Test discovering in controllers. Models description and discovery logic changing

New pure init revision for alembic (other have been deleted). Some non-major refactoring to other files

All system was refactored in order to support new logic of discovering test_sets and tests in ostf runtime

Non-major fix in fabfile. For unit tests logic that controlls data writing to db from tests has been added. Test for nose_discovery have been supplied

Some non-major fixes to nose_discovery plugin. Unit tests for nose_discovery have been finished

deployments_types_tests were added for the purpose of testing new discovery behaviour and with intesions to keep logic defined with dummy_tests. Unit tests for nose discovery have been fixed.

New fake empty tests were added just to keep logic defined in dummy_tests

Unit tests for wsgi_controllers have been fixed

unit tests for wsgi controllers have been finished

Some fixes to wsgi contorollers (now test_set controller returns non
first result from query but all; test controller return all tests with
no test_run id present within it). Nose discovery function was fixed:
now it searches for test_sets for given cluster id without checking data
in db (in this case sqlalchemy merge should prevent from making
dublicates). Some methods in nose_storage_plugin were fixed for the sake
of supporting new behaviour of get_description function (with new
addition value returning - deployment_tags). Attemptings to rewrite
functional tests were made thus TestingAdapterClient was modified. Some
other non-major fixes were added.

New changes to nose_discovery func (checking out of cluster's
redeploying, implementing is not finished). Some changed to controllers
(mostly to returning value). Nose discovery tests were changed in order
to implement future changes. Proper processing of debug_tests path was
added to wsgi_utils.

Some fixes to discovery logic and different tests

BaseTestingAdapter was simplified. Several functional tests have been
fixed.

For Test class new element 'disabled' for statuses enumerate was added.
New initial_migration was added (since models were modified). Functional
tests were fixed to support new logic.

Smth strange with wsgi_utils.

Test for redeployed cluster were added to test_wsgi_controllers.py.
multinode_deployment_tests were fixed.

Change-Id: Ie9acfc6b57c4c3d2d1e5a7480929328fb193bf2c
"}]
commit_message:
Field 'deployment_tags' for tests and test_sets alongside with migration to
support these changes were added. To fabfile task that performs creation
of new alembic migration was added. Additional refactoring and non-major
fixes.

cluster_id field was added for test_sets (migration script was
supplied). Logic of discovering test_sets and tests was moved to
controllers (test-set controller). Nose plugin was refactored. Tests was not be
supplied for new features.

Test discovering in controllers. Models description and discovery logic changing

New pure init revision for alembic (other have been deleted). Some non-major refactoring to other files

All system was refactored in order to support new logic of discovering test_sets and tests in ostf runtime

Non-major fix in fabfile. For unit tests logic that controlls data writing to db from tests has been added. Test for nose_discovery have been supplied

Some non-major fixes to nose_discovery plugin. Unit tests for nose_discovery have been finished

deployments_types_tests were added for the purpose of testing new discovery behaviour and with intesions to keep logic defined with dummy_tests. Unit tests for nose discovery have been fixed.

New fake empty tests were added just to keep logic defined in dummy_tests

Unit tests for wsgi_controllers have been fixed

unit tests for wsgi controllers have been finished

Some fixes to wsgi contorollers (now test_set controller returns non
first result from query but all; test controller return all tests with
no test_run id present within it). Nose discovery function was fixed:
now it searches for test_sets for given cluster id without checking data
in db (in this case sqlalchemy merge should prevent from making
dublicates). Some methods in nose_storage_plugin were fixed for the sake
of supporting new behaviour of get_description function (with new
addition value returning - deployment_tags). Attemptings to rewrite
functional tests were made thus TestingAdapterClient was modified. Some
other non-major fixes were added.

New changes to nose_discovery func (checking out of cluster's
redeploying, implementing is not finished). Some changed to controllers
(mostly to returning value). Nose discovery tests were changed in order
to implement future changes. Proper processing of debug_tests path was
added to wsgi_utils.

Some fixes to discovery logic and different tests

BaseTestingAdapter was simplified. Several functional tests have been
fixed.

For Test class new element 'disabled' for statuses enumerate was added.
New initial_migration was added (since models were modified). Functional
tests were fixed to support new logic.

Smth strange with wsgi_utils.

Test for redeployed cluster were added to test_wsgi_controllers.py.
multinode_deployment_tests were fixed.

Change-Id: Ie9acfc6b57c4c3d2d1e5a7480929328fb193bf2c

commit_message:
Apply six for metaclass

__metaclass__ cannot be used in python3.
six be used in general for python 3 compatibility.

Change-Id: I1d9909d70bb614c9d1c336d0c492027f5b6b5088
Closes-Bug: #1236648

commit_message:
HOT str_replace default to empty string for param

If a str_replace param cannot be resolved or is None,
substitute an empty string in order to prevent raising
an exception during validate.

Closes Bug: #1234390
Change-Id: Ica6b84cfc2157b4e1f561f737e9aa67b9f6018ca

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 10:46:41.000000000', 'message': 'Handle NetworkNotFoundClient and PortNotFoundClient

neutronclient has changed is behavior (recently?) in that it now
raises PortNotFoundClient for missing ports and NetworkNotFoundClient
for missing nets. These exceptions extend NeutronClientException but
do not set the status_code to 404 so the existing resource 404
checking has stopped working.

This change handles both 404 exceptions and the new exceptions
so that it continues to work with different neutron releases.

Change-Id: Id06e04d4b98e62b8062b119e959634fd61c8beb5
Closes-Bug: #1234924
'}]
commit_message:
Handle NetworkNotFoundClient and PortNotFoundClient

neutronclient has changed is behavior (recently?) in that it now
raises PortNotFoundClient for missing ports and NetworkNotFoundClient
for missing nets. These exceptions extend NeutronClientException but
do not set the status_code to 404 so the existing resource 404
checking has stopped working.

This change handles both 404 exceptions and the new exceptions
so that it continues to work with different neutron releases.

Change-Id: Id06e04d4b98e62b8062b119e959634fd61c8beb5
Closes-Bug: #1234924

[{'created': '2013-10-08 10:39:47.000000000', 'message': 'Handle BadRequest in VolumeDetachTask

Novaclient raises BadRequest(400) if a volume is already
detached when delete_server_volume is called.

This change treats BadRequest the same as a NotFound in the
VolumeDetachTask, and logs the actual exception string.

Change-Id: I34c01a493e8c87281d2adecb6d4404376cf78738
Closes-Bug: #1232234
'}]
commit_message:
Handle BadRequest in VolumeDetachTask

Novaclient raises BadRequest(400) if a volume is already
detached when delete_server_volume is called.

This change treats BadRequest the same as a NotFound in the
VolumeDetachTask, and logs the actual exception string.

Change-Id: I34c01a493e8c87281d2adecb6d4404376cf78738
Closes-Bug: #1232234

commit_message:
Fixing incorrect mocks usage in unit tests

This patch fixes some incorrect mocks usage in the unit tests for Rally.
Those mocks were initialized in a wrong way (via the start() method in the
test case setUp()) which presented an opportunity for a race condition.
Here, this get replaced with "with ... as ..." blocks.

Change-Id: Ifad16ee6454abcb42e05bb187842a6682d7924db
Closes-Bug: #1236725

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 09:46:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix for verify_network with incomplete data

verify_networks_resp fails with
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'received_network' referenced before assignment
if network data on first node is empty, if it is empty on second
received_network of previous node will be used..

Use data from cached_network cause received_network should be mirror of cached_networki
but it isn't in case of errors

Change-Id: I636e6f218650f844b5872b5a1d8621787abac956
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for verify_network with incomplete data

verify_networks_resp fails with
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'received_network' referenced before assignment
if network data on first node is empty, if it is empty on second
received_network of previous node will be used..

Use data from cached_network cause received_network should be mirror of cached_networki
but it isn't in case of errors

Change-Id: I636e6f218650f844b5872b5a1d8621787abac956

commit_message:
resource_id check on router gateway, interface delete

This change prevents RouterGateway and RouterInterface
delete failing if create never managed to set the resource_id.

Change-Id: I88ba2dd9b92546fca684dad2f921c6caf8467367
Closes-Bug: #1231805

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-07 08:24:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix sqlalchemy load_db_driver hook for web.py
I found that only reason why it can fail with InvalidRequestError is need for rollback
and in case of web.HTTPError it doesnot happend

In case of handling exception and uncomplet model is present in session
rollback it, even in case of HTTPError

Change-Id: Ic530528278df1245cda4bbd27309232cf7e567a6
'}, {'created': '2013-10-07 14:05:59.000000000', 'message': 'Bug sqlalchemy load_db_driver hook for web.py

Problem: Sqlalchemy session fails with InvalidRequestError
in case of errors during flush

Solution: I found that only reason why it can fail with
InvalidRequestError is need for rollback and in case of web.HTTPError it doesnot happend
So rollback session without any special cases (e.g. web.HTTPError)

Change-Id: Ic530528278df1245cda4bbd27309232cf7e567a6
'}]
commit_message:
Bug sqlalchemy load_db_driver hook for web.py

Problem: Sqlalchemy session fails with InvalidRequestError
in case of errors during flush

Solution: I found that only reason why it can fail with
InvalidRequestError is need for rollback and in case of web.HTTPError it doesnot happend
So rollback session without any special cases (e.g. web.HTTPError)

Change-Id: Ic530528278df1245cda4bbd27309232cf7e567a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 10:24:51.000000000', 'message': 'Close FDs for subprocesses

Subprocess module does not automatically close file descriptors for
pipes connected to child processes. Hence FDs leak on each cluster
launch. That commit fixes the bug.

Change-Id: I03a52d61acd6316d8fc5026c8eb5d38ad7d0e269
'}]
commit_message:
Close FDs for subprocesses

Subprocess module does not automatically close file descriptors for
pipes connected to child processes. Hence FDs leak on each cluster
launch. That commit fixes the bug.

Change-Id: I03a52d61acd6316d8fc5026c8eb5d38ad7d0e269

commit_message:
Excessive log was deleted

Python-swiftclient which is used in integration tests writes a lot of unnecessary logs.
Now python-swiftclient does not write these unnecessary logs.

Change-Id: I72688577e337cff612d984f4533a842f0f7d0f7d

commit_message:
Fix Bad parameter to ConfigFilesNotFoundError

path is not a proper parameter to __init__ method of
ConfigFilesNotFoundError, we should switch to a tuple

Change-Id: I5288f0a8666f9227244a047e7402b10951628d14
Closes-Bug: 1236176

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-04 22:30:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix problem with starting Windows 7 instances using VMware Driver

The default controller for a Windows 7 virtual machine is the
LSI Logic SAS. When the disk adapter type is specified as 'lsiLogic'
via glance image metadata, VMware driver defaults to LSI Logic Parallel
controller. With this fix the driver will honor a property 'lsiLogicsas'
to distinguish the right adapter and enable booting Windows instances.

Fixes: bug #1187853
Change-Id: Idb36a784a31e4938e8951adeb83335b3890dac85
(cherry picked from commit 16a9853fe3924ccaf987b2a1628f27bb9c03b950)
"}, {'created': '2013-10-07 07:59:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix problem with starting Windows 7 instances using VMware Driver

LSI Logic SAS. When the disk adapter type is specified as 'lsiLogic'
via glance image metadata, VMware driver defaults to LSI Logic Parallel
controller. With this fix the driver will honor a property 'lsiLogicsas'
to distinguish the right adapter and enable booting Windows instances.

Fixes: bug #1187853
Change-Id: Idb36a784a31e4938e8951adeb83335b3890dac85
(cherry picked from commit 16a9853fe3924ccaf987b2a1628f27bb9c03b950)

commit_message:
Fix problem with starting Windows 7 instances using VMware Driver

The default controller for a Windows 7 virtual machine is the
LSI Logic SAS. When the disk adapter type is specified as 'lsiLogic'
via glance image metadata, VMware driver defaults to LSI Logic Parallel
controller. With this fix the driver will honor a property 'lsiLogicsas'
to distinguish the right adapter and enable booting Windows instances.

Fixes: bug #1187853
Change-Id: Idb36a784a31e4938e8951adeb83335b3890dac85
(cherry picked from commit 16a9853fe3924ccaf987b2a1628f27bb9c03b950)

'}, {'account_id': 6944, 'date': '2013-10-07 19:59:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Turns out that this requires some patching in eventlet to work correctly.

See: https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/7

The correct way to implement forwarding with requests + eventlet is:

    import eventlet
    requests = eventlet.import_patched("requests")

That removes the eventlet.spawn cost and implicitly replaces all network communication that requests must do with  greenlet-friendly version.'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-10-07 21:36:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the heads up. Could you abandon this patch?'}, {'account_id': 6944, 'date': '2013-10-08 10:57:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Abandoned due to conflicts between requests and eventlet.'}]

commit_message:
feat: async forwarding

This patch adds eventlet to the proxy mix for async forwarding. This
should allow the proxy to handle connections more quickly,
particularly concurrent connections.

The data streaming bug is also fixed in this patch.

Change-Id: I5868ed9fda781d723743de87b7d4f37fe854da10
Closes-Bug: 1230388
Implements: blueprint placement-service

discussion is happening via email regarding config option tables."}, {'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2013-10-07 06:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Replied to the email. We use config opts in several ways and hence its imperative for us to override the tool behavior for conveying the right information about the flags to the user.'}, {'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2013-10-07 08:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi Tom,
         Thanks for proposing the plan. We do want to address the formatting and text concerns the documentation team has. So while we fix the document for using the tool, I would request you to come up with your review comments(other than the tool process, which we will address) about the format and text that you think does not meet standards and needs to be changed.

Also we need to discuss this with larger documentation team and come to a common agreement to address situations when vendors want to override the default auto generated table and as I see this can come over time and again in different releases.

Thanks
Navneet'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-10-07 08:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Do not merge

This patch contains long tables which contain content duplicated several times. These are not the best way to convey this information to the reader - resulting in cluttered documentation and removal of the single point of reference intended by the configuration reference. In addition, they are also significantly increasing the maintenance burden as they do not use the automated tool.

Instead, we need to create a single table for reference and use plain English text that refers to the options, and specialised configuration file snippets as appropriate. 

Suggested plan to achieve this:

1. update cinder.flagmappings with all of the netapp options to create a new table common/tables/cinder-netapp.xml
2. modify the generated table manually with option text that doesn't suck
3. sending an email to the mailing list asking politely that if anyone runs the autogen tool, not to override this table, until it is fixed in the code
4. create a new section "List of configuration options" for the netapp driver
5. Modify the sections in the document to make reference to these options using English text, removing the original tables
6. approve the doc patch
7. patch the cinder code as soon as stable/havana is open'}, {'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2013-10-07 15:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-07 15:12:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-openstack-manuals-validate http://logs.openstack.org/19/49119/6/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/55996a4 : SUCCESS in 4m 01s
'}, {'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2013-10-08 10:37:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned'}]

FOR REVIEWERS: I realize that this is the patch that needs to land so that the corresponding tempest change can be merged (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41635/) so this is why Jenkins -1s it"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-08-16 12:25:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Not clear to me why all of the API samples have to change as part of fixing this bug ?   Its not that the new samples are wrong, I just don't understand why as it seems to imply a more extensive change.

Also since your fixing this at the API level, isn't the same fix needed in the V3 API ?

And agree with Nikola - more of the description in the Bug report needs to be in the commit message"}, {'account_id': 7441, 'date': '2013-08-19 06:45:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I had to change the api-samples for flavor-access, as there will be flavor-access created by default for the tenant who created a private flavor. So, this flavor-access is included in flavor-access while listing, creating and removing.

For V3, there is no flavor_manage extension at all to create a flavor. Looks like, a flavor cannot be created at all in V3 api. There can be a separate ticket to create a flavor_manage extension for V3. Let me know your comments.'}, {'account_id': 7441, 'date': '2013-08-19 06:45:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7441, 'date': '2013-08-19 06:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-08-19 06:49:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-08-19 16:55:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-08-20 15:49:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Actually - I didn't look at this closely enough - what I said in the previous review is to move the creation of into the falvors.create method.

Create method is also used in the manage.py (not that we care about it - but we should keep the creation complete and not make people think about weahter access needs to be created if they use it elsewhere)"}, {'account_id': 7441, 'date': '2013-08-21 09:01:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hmmmm... Here are my thoughts not to push creating flavor_access inside flavors's create method.

To add a flavor_access, it needs to know the tenant id to add access to. Right now, flavors's create method is not aware of any context or project_id. I need to change the contract of this method to get a context/project_id, which wont be used by flavors model but on flavor_access model. This does not seem to be correct.

I believe flavors's create should just worry about flavors only and not about other model. All the extra logic should stay with controller as is now."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-08-21 09:10:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I don't agree - we should improve flavor 'contracts' (or as I like to call it - the module's public API) as we go along - they are not user facing.

However - I don't feel strongly enough about it - and this does fix a bug so +2"}, {'account_id': 7203, 'date': '2013-08-23 06:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-09-02 15:16:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I like the idea of this change, but this seems to change the semantics of adding a private flavor, so it seems to be against the spirt of:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/APIChangeGuidelines

Also, if this change were OK, it should also be made to work with the v3 API:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/flavor_manage.py#L75

I would +2 this change if it were made only to the v3 API, or if there was an extra property to trigger this behavior in the v2 API, like the tenant_id or and add_flavour_access=True flag in the API request."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-09-02 15:33:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

John - I am not sure I agree with disqualifying this change baased on the API Change guidelines document you linked - it fixes an obvious bug, does not remove anything from the response, and there are a few examples on that page where fixing an obviously buggy behavior is OK to accept.

I'd agree that we should fix this in the V3 api as well (this would however come for free if the fix was made where I suggested for it to be made)."}, {'account_id': 7441, 'date': '2013-09-03 11:01:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7441, 'date': '2013-09-03 11:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Added V3 support'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-03 11:28:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Still looks good to me'}, {'account_id': 7203, 'date': '2013-09-06 01:43:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-09-06 18:18:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am on the fence about if this should be considered an API change.  At the very least this patch needs a docImpact flag. But because this changes the behavior of the API I am inclined to say that we shouldn't change the v2 API.  If someone has a script that uses this API this change can break it."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-09-06 18:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I kind of see your point Joe, and I was surprised at first that a bug fix needed to change the doc samples.

But without this fix the flavor-access mechanism is broken as far as I can see, and the extra data returned is still compatible with the API definition I think (Its just that an optional list part that was always empty before will now have one entry from the start) - so any code that uses the API really needs to be able to cope with that part of the
result.

So I would go with needing a DocImpact, but not block it on compatibility grounds.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2013-09-07 07:15:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

In normally, I can't create flavor by non-admin user. I need change the config for policy, but it make sense to me, because user can change the config.

But there still have problem for auth both in v2 and v3, please reference
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L4321

'flavor_access_add' require admin user. So still can't create flavor by non-admin user. you should use 'context.get_admin_context()' when invoke it."}, {'account_id': 7441, 'date': '2013-09-12 10:30:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7441, 'date': '2013-09-12 10:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Added DocImpact in Commit message.

Alex Xu,

I did not get the flavor_access_add bit. Since this is just about creating flavor access by admin users while, adding private users, it would not come in the way of not having admin context at all. The non-admin users still cannot create flavors(public/private)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-12 11:00:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

commit_message:
Create flavor-access for the tenant when creating
a private flavor

In FlavorManage extension, a change has been made to
create flavor-access for a corresponding tenant on
creating a private flavor

This also requires the api-samples for flavor-access
to be changed, since there will be a flavor-access created
by default on creating a private flavor

This commit has a DocImpact

Change-Id: I7795fbd04ae9fc8b1ea6fb27203dfa5217d310ce
Fixes: bug 1209101

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 08:54:06.000000000', 'message': "Bugfix for verify_networks_resp with incomplete data

verify_networks_resp fails with
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'received_network' referenced before assignment
if network data on first node is empty, if it is empty on second
received_network of previous node will be used..

Use data from cached_network cause received_network should be mirror of cached_networki
but it isn't in case of errors

Change-Id: I96e7e58e41a9699c5c41d78e181d499a9ea9f1b9
"}]
commit_message:
Bugfix for verify_networks_resp with incomplete data

verify_networks_resp fails with
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'received_network' referenced before assignment
if network data on first node is empty, if it is empty on second
received_network of previous node will be used..

Use data from cached_network cause received_network should be mirror of cached_networki
but it isn't in case of errors

Change-Id: I96e7e58e41a9699c5c41d78e181d499a9ea9f1b9

[{'created': '2013-10-07 23:07:31.000000000', 'message': "Set my_ip for nova.

If we don't set this, when public IP is different to the management
network, Neutron may be given bad IP's for TFTP booting due to bug
1236623.

Change-Id: I007e5bd92979c984c346b23a78ddb7cf4b030b73
Related-Bug: #1236623
"}]
commit_message:
Set my_ip for nova.

If we don't set this, when public IP is different to the management
network, Neutron may be given bad IP's for TFTP booting due to bug
1236623.

Change-Id: I007e5bd92979c984c346b23a78ddb7cf4b030b73
Related-Bug: #1236623

commit_message:
Element to build and maintain local pypi mirror

We use the instructions from diskimage-builder's pypi element README to
create a copy for use with elements which need to build images more
rapidly.

commit_message:
Don't require no_proxy to be set in devtest_*

If no_proxy isn't set don't halt, just set it and continue.  Same
pattern as in devtest_seed.sh

'}, {'created': '2013-10-07 18:47:10.000000000', 'message': 'Make RHEL subscription optional

commit_message:
Make RHEL subscription optional

The code to handle unregister of RHEL subscriptions was buggy and
broke if no subscription credentials were supplied.

Change-Id: Iac29c45f207725e31eac6487a87367fcd3d34d49

commit_message:
Remove tools/validate.py

The gates are using tools/test.py now and thus we can
delete tools/validate.py.

Change-Id: I38969ac13b78ec7429b73c32bfc9a159fabcd556

commit_message:
Using python to run testr instead

So tox will not report bash is not installed in testenv.

Fixes bug #1233024

Change-Id: Ifed717df51340b2834f2f0522125a842495dcdda

[{'created': '2013-10-02 13:46:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix snapshot failure with VMwareVCDriver

The snapshot operation was failing because it calls
VirtualDiskManager.CopyVirtualDisk with a destination disk spec, which
is not supported when called through VC. The fix is to not supply a spec
when calling through VC, in which case the disk is consolidated and
copied without type transformation.

While the fix is to use spec-less CopyVirtualDisk in VC, doing so in ESX
too will result in unintended transformation (because it ESX will
default to busLogic/preallocated), so the use of the spec was retained
in ESX-mode instead.

Another issue found and fixed is that the name of the snapshot image is
incorrectly set when uploading to glance.

The following tempest tests are now unbroken against the VC and ESX
nodes:
  tempest.api.compute.images.
     test_images_oneserver.ImagesOneServerTest{JSON,XML}.
        test_create_delete_image
        test_create_second_image_when_first_image_is_being_saved
        test_delete_image_of_another_tenant
     test_list_image_filters
  tempest.api.compute.test_authorization.AuthorizationTestJSON
  tempest.api.compute.test_authorization.AuthorizationTestXML

Fixes bug 1184807

(cherry picked from commit 61bfac8881dd6a71a572a54b2ea1680248fc4bc4)

Conflicts:

        nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
        nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py
        nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I08717a06f23dd1abfd5ccae7606a7ecb1453dc8c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix snapshot failure with VMwareVCDriver

The snapshot operation was failing because it calls
VirtualDiskManager.CopyVirtualDisk with a destination disk spec, which
is not supported when called through VC. The fix is to not supply a spec
when calling through VC, in which case the disk is consolidated and
copied without type transformation.

While the fix is to use spec-less CopyVirtualDisk in VC, doing so in ESX
too will result in unintended transformation (because it ESX will
default to busLogic/preallocated), so the use of the spec was retained
in ESX-mode instead.

Another issue found and fixed is that the name of the snapshot image is
incorrectly set when uploading to glance.

The following tempest tests are now unbroken against the VC and ESX
nodes:
  tempest.api.compute.images.
     test_images_oneserver.ImagesOneServerTest{JSON,XML}.
        test_create_delete_image
        test_create_second_image_when_first_image_is_being_saved
        test_delete_image_of_another_tenant
     test_list_image_filters
  tempest.api.compute.test_authorization.AuthorizationTestJSON
  tempest.api.compute.test_authorization.AuthorizationTestXML

Fixes bug 1184807

(cherry picked from commit 61bfac8881dd6a71a572a54b2ea1680248fc4bc4)

Conflicts:

        nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
        nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py
        nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I08717a06f23dd1abfd5ccae7606a7ecb1453dc8c

commit_message:
Avoid clobbering {system_,}metadata dicts passed to instance update

Right now, the dicts for metadata items passed to instance_update
methods will get clobbered as part of the save. This patch makes
a copy before doing the update to avoid this.

Change-Id: I546692779a7467c5cb309059bb46a9bc9b62d5f1

commit_message:
Utilize assertIsInstance

Using assertTrue and the 'isinstance' function to test
if an object is in an instance of some class is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIsInstance which was created
for these types of tests. Let's use assertIsInstance for these tests.

Fixes bug #1230028

Change-Id: Ia03c9f19a1c5e2aef3a6fe530515bd26339a7975

commit_message:
Unskip cli-keystone catalog and help tests

Unskip tests which were skipped before pinning python-keyring to
not-faulty version as per bug 1193164.

This reverts commit 27e8547c31f15708b3ff143a62eb96742b287d26.

Change-Id: I1c4c4a509f4629eb8aeb1963e1c9623338d65453

commit_message:
Cleanup and more tests for db.api methods

New tests for methods:

 backup_*
 quota_*
 reservation_*
 snapshot_*
 transfer_*
 volume_*

Removed unnecessary methods:

 quota_usage_create
 volume_metadata_get_item
 snapshot_metadata_get_item
 volume_type_extra_specs_get_item
 exact_filter

Improved coverage of existing tests.

Improved ModelsObjectComparatorMixin.

blueprint: db-api-tests

Change-Id: Ia2a3845f27a7b4b08fd8a16c6010513d213e642f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-07 16:48:32.000000000', 'message': 'Drop conf_key_mgr warning message.

By default ConfKeyManager logs tons of WARNING message stating
that it isn't production ready...

Given that it is currently the only Cinder key manager option
which can be used/selected I don't think repeatedly logging
warnings is helpful. Lets just drop the warning message
for now and when a good "production ready" cinder key manager
implementation is implemented perhaps we can re-add a warning to
this class (hopefully making the production ready impl the default).

Change-Id: Id1fdddc20a963f9fa4749ad57f355cd83d0e14e3
Closes-Bug: #1236459
'}, {'created': '2013-10-07 18:08:25.000000000', 'message': 'Drop conf_key_mgr warning message!

By default ConfKeyManager logs tons of WARNING message stating
that it isn't production ready...

Given that it is currently the only Cinder key manager option
which can be used/selected I don't think repeatedly logging
warnings is helpful. Lets just drop the warning message
for now and when a good "production ready" cinder key manager
implementation is implemented perhaps we can re-add a warning to
this class (hopefully making the production ready impl the default).

Change-Id: Id1fdddc20a963f9fa4749ad57f355cd83d0e14e3
Closes-Bug: #1236459
'}]
commit_message:
Drop conf_key_mgr warning message!

By default ConfKeyManager logs tons of WARNING message stating
that it isn't production ready...

Given that it is currently the only Cinder key manager option
which can be used/selected I don't think repeatedly logging
warnings is helpful. Lets just drop the warning message
for now and when a good "production ready" cinder key manager
implementation is implemented perhaps we can re-add a warning to
this class (hopefully making the production ready impl the default).

Change-Id: Id1fdddc20a963f9fa4749ad57f355cd83d0e14e3
Closes-Bug: #1236459

@doug, that's not part of the incubation requirements. It was asked why we didn't picked Pecan but it was not made a strong requirement for graduation. AFAIR."}, {'account_id': 6427, 'date': '2013-09-20 17:08:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As I recall, the incubation vote was taken under the understanding that we would fully evaluate Pecan, but there was no hard graduation requirement that we must use it. We are striving for a pragmatic approach here; generally speaking, I don't think it would be prudent to force the project to use Pecan without it being fully vetted by the team.

See also: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/marconi/+spec/pecan-framework

We can discuss this further in #openstack-marconi if you like."}, {'account_id': 6427, 'date': '2013-09-24 14:55:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 15:58:44.000000000', 'message': 'Allow the new Falcon 0.1.7 series

Marconi's home document does not list all endpoints, instead relying on
"follow-your-nose" client behavior. To facilitate discoverability,
Marconi relies on Falcon 0.1.7's new automatic OPTIONS support. Marconi
has been tested with the new version of Falcon, and no breaking changes
were found.

Note that Marconi will still work fine with Falcon 0.1.6, except clients
will not be able to probe endpoints using the OPTIONS method.

Change-Id: I3394800cfd5fb7a36c604b9d2e7c04ffb5bf9828
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the new Falcon 0.1.7 series

Marconi's home document does not list all endpoints, instead relying on
"follow-your-nose" client behavior. To facilitate discoverability,
Marconi relies on Falcon 0.1.7's new automatic OPTIONS support. Marconi
has been tested with the new version of Falcon, and no breaking changes
were found.

Note that Marconi will still work fine with Falcon 0.1.6, except clients
will not be able to probe endpoints using the OPTIONS method.

Change-Id: I3394800cfd5fb7a36c604b9d2e7c04ffb5bf9828

Some change for tempest/openstack/common/log.py:_get_log_file_path:
1. raise an exception, when logfile and logdir are both unset
2. Use if...else.., insteadof so many return clause.

Change-Id: I03dcaa84cd60b8a05823abbb4db0cdfff728c49e
Closes-Bug: #1232884
'}]
commit_message:
_get_log_file_path is incorrect, when logfile and logdire unset

Some change for tempest/openstack/common/log.py:_get_log_file_path:
1. raise an exception, when logfile and logdir are both unset
2. Use if...else.., insteadof so many return clause.

Change-Id: I03dcaa84cd60b8a05823abbb4db0cdfff728c49e
Closes-Bug: #1232884

commit_message:
Update tempest to latest tox and requirements

tempest is still using the d2to1 version of pbr, which is evil. Also,
the requirements list is out of date. Also, we should update the tox.ini
file so that sdist/install is replaced with develop because it's faster.

Change-Id: I5d353f32db8b72f0150e5d1d7ecaa6c38d6d9300

port test_absolute_limits into v3 part1

This changeset only copies the v2 files into the appropriate v3
directories unchanged. This is being tried in order to make
reviewing of the porting easier as gerrit will display only what
is actually changed for v3 rather than entirely new files.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api-tests

commit_message:
Add H234 check to avoid (x)range() function usage

There is use of range() and xrange() functions in the OpenStack
project. But it cause issues  if we support both Python 2.x and
3.x because the range() function has been removed in Python 3.x
and xrange() renamed to range().

So we should use xrange() function from six.moves for Python 2.x
and 3.x compatibility.

Closes-Bug: #1196884

Change-Id: I0a6ffc7614ebf41d779c29e565510a0824e5f10f

First, this change seems to break an NEC plugin unit test. Either that test needs to be fixed or the NEC plugin needs to be fixed, or another approach is needed.

Second, I think the delete_port() call needs to be made outside the transaction, but before the transaction that deletes the network. See my in-line comment for details.

'}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-09-27 20:21:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-09-30 04:55:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Regarding the unit test failure in NEC plugin, a simple change in the unit test solves the failure. The patch is: http://paste.openstack.org/show/47682/

NEC plugin explicitly deletes auto-deletion ports (i.e., dhcp ports) from an external OpenFlow controller when deleting a network.
The failed unit tests strictly checks the sequence of the operations to an OpenFlow controller and this is the cause of the unit test failure in NEC plugin. The patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/48546/ changes db plugin to call a plugin delete_port, and it adds an additional check of presense of a port on an OpenFlow controller. This is just a check of a port presense and it does not affect the behavior of NEC plugin.

I tested NEC plugin with this patch and confirmed it worked as expected.


My only concern about this patch is that calling plugin delete_port() from db_plugin.delete_network may lead to longer database transaction, especially with plugins which talk with external network controllers.

Thanks,
Akihiro'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-09-30 17:30:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The issue has been resolved for ML2 via https://review.openstack.org/#/c/48765/1/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py, which has been merged, so this patch should probably be abandoned.

The fix changes Ml2Plugin.delete_network() to no longer call NeutronDBPluginV2.delete_network(), and instead use the plugin's methods to auto-delete the network's ports and subnets outside the transaction context. This way all expected ML2 mechanism driver methods will be called for the auto-deletions, and no postcommit() methods will be called inside a transaction. A loop prevents race conditions if ports or subnets are created asynchronously.

A similar fix could be implemented in NeutronDBPluginV2.delete_network(), and the ML2 change reverted. But a number of plugins have code dealing with auto-deletions that might need modification, so this may be considered too risky for this point in the havana cycle."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-09-30 22:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree with Bob.

I think the change itself is the right direction, but it has a potential risk in havana and looks better to wait for Icehouse.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-10-08 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-10-08 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-27 00:24:49.000000000', 'message': "ML2 plugin does not delete dhcp port upon deletion of network

fixes bug: 1230330

When a network is deleted, the dhcp port is not deleted. The port is
deleted in Neutron DB, but the delete_port() request is never sent to
the ML2 plugin.

The issue is that db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDBPluginV2.delete_network()
   invokes _delete_port() as oppose to delete_port() which bypasses the
   invoking plugin's context and hence does not invoke invoking plugin's
   delete_port(). This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Ie1d30ca37cc70e2c47b46df30db230e771e0f74f
"}]
commit_message:
ML2 plugin does not delete dhcp port upon deletion of network

fixes bug: 1230330

When a network is deleted, the dhcp port is not deleted. The port is
deleted in Neutron DB, but the delete_port() request is never sent to
the ML2 plugin.

The issue is that db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDBPluginV2.delete_network()
   invokes _delete_port() as oppose to delete_port() which bypasses the
   invoking plugin's context and hence does not invoke invoking plugin's
   delete_port(). This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Ie1d30ca37cc70e2c47b46df30db230e771e0f74f

[{'created': '2013-09-30 08:45:20.000000000', 'message': 'Adds missing notification for pause/unpause

The pause and unpause operations are missing notifications for
the operation, This patch adds the notification for pause/unpause
and related unit tests.

Closes bug #1233018

Change-Id: Id3c7598922a50678d734404851c1f95eb9376b54
'}]
commit_message:
Adds missing notification for pause/unpause

The pause and unpause operations are missing notifications for
the operation, This patch adds the notification for pause/unpause
and related unit tests.

Closes bug #1233018

Change-Id: Id3c7598922a50678d734404851c1f95eb9376b54

[{'created': '2013-10-07 18:10:26.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore H803 from Hacking.

H803 checks for a period in commit messages, something the community
clearly rejected as a sensible check: periods in commit messages
should neither be rejected or required.

Change-Id: I754e10ca01b3e6f8c6482e1bcd4c2e2ca8c1cfc9
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore H803 from Hacking.

H803 checks for a period in commit messages, something the community
clearly rejected as a sensible check: periods in commit messages
should neither be rejected or required.

Change-Id: I754e10ca01b3e6f8c6482e1bcd4c2e2ca8c1cfc9

commit_message:
Utilizes assertIsNone and assertIsNotNone

Using assertTrue and the 'is' operator to test if an element is None
is too python2.4. Our unit testing framework supports
assertIsNone and assertIsNotNone which were created
for these types of tests.

Fixes bug #1230028

Change-Id: Ia58d92c52d0aca9c22360dd44de19d4e5878ab13

Start the watcher task if a nested stack has watches

Even if the parent stack has no watches.

Change-Id: I06322f908fdbd474778776749cb3e1634183ed23
Partial-Bug: #1234010

Nexenta iSCSI driver fix _lu_exists

Catch "does not exist" exception of NMS scsidisk lu_exists method.

Closes-Bug: #1236626

[{'created': '2013-09-10 12:25:22.000000000', 'message': "Call to_primitive on volumes.rpcapi.create_volume

cinder.volume.rpcapi.create_volume does not convert the request_spec to
primitive before casting the request. This makes requests containing non
primitive types to fail. For example:

cinder create --metadata=Type=test --source-volid $VOLID 1

This will create a new database record and call create_volume on
volume.rpcapi.  This will fail because VolumeMetadata won't be
serialized correctly when calling cast. This, however, is not True when
--source-volid is not passed because in such case,
scheduler.rpcpai.create_volume will be called, which converts
request_spec to primitive correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1213964

Conflicts:
	cinder/volume/rpcapi.py

(cherry-picked: 587eb5a6b9acc9f02eee1147dbaafb3782c295d5)

Change-Id: I4b91687cc1e5c933bdb3b04d8560b0500da26541
"}, {'created': '2013-09-17 11:30:23.000000000', 'message': "Call to_primitive on volumes.rpcapi.create_volume

cinder create --metadata=Type=test --source-volid $VOLID 1

Closes-Bug 1213964

	cinder/volume/rpcapi.py

(cherry-picked: 587eb5a6b9acc9f02eee1147dbaafb3782c295d5)

Change-Id: I4b91687cc1e5c933bdb3b04d8560b0500da26541
"}]
commit_message:
Call to_primitive on volumes.rpcapi.create_volume

cinder.volume.rpcapi.create_volume does not convert the request_spec to
primitive before casting the request. This makes requests containing non
primitive types to fail. For example:

cinder create --metadata=Type=test --source-volid $VOLID 1

This will create a new database record and call create_volume on
volume.rpcapi.  This will fail because VolumeMetadata won't be
serialized correctly when calling cast. This, however, is not True when
--source-volid is not passed because in such case,
scheduler.rpcpai.create_volume will be called, which converts
request_spec to primitive correctly.

Closes-Bug 1213964

Conflicts:
	cinder/volume/rpcapi.py

(cherry-picked: 587eb5a6b9acc9f02eee1147dbaafb3782c295d5)

Change-Id: I4b91687cc1e5c933bdb3b04d8560b0500da26541

commit_message:
Show an error message on instance launch error

Since instance creation happens asynchronously, all that currently
happens on the Horizon side is the state changes from Creating to Error.

This change checks the instance state during the Ajax request on the
backend and returns an Ajax error message popup if the status is
'ERROR'.

Change-Id: I259e27b7b6c73a38098514a701c235feb81af143
Closes-bug: 1236168.

[{'created': '2013-10-06 20:50:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a issue on retrieving default quota in Create Project

quota names for security group are different between nova and neutron,
so the same appoach can be used for floating IP. This commit reverts
the change in get_default_quota_data in commit c44552fe66 and changes
get_disabled_quotas to determine security group and rules quotas come
from nova or neutron.

Change-Id: I9e39ac99f1e8c7ccdce64b2e2ab79615cac50892
Closes-Bug: #1235053
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a issue on retrieving default quota in Create Project

quota names for security group are different between nova and neutron,
so the same appoach can be used for floating IP. This commit reverts
the change in get_default_quota_data in commit c44552fe66 and changes
get_disabled_quotas to determine security group and rules quotas come
from nova or neutron.

Change-Id: I9e39ac99f1e8c7ccdce64b2e2ab79615cac50892
Closes-Bug: #1235053

[{'created': '2013-10-04 05:21:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix clashing loop variables

There was two loops using "v" as a variable name.
This patch makes all these variables a bit more verbose.

Closes-bug: #1235077
Change-Id: I5198621ce724abe9638da4a7482ae6817bbd86e7
'}, {'created': '2013-10-07 11:13:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix clashing loop variables in TemplateResource

Closes-bug: #1235077
Change-Id: I5198621ce724abe9638da4a7482ae6817bbd86e7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix clashing loop variables in TemplateResource

There were two loops using "v" as a variable name.

Closes-bug: #1235077
Change-Id: I5198621ce724abe9638da4a7482ae6817bbd86e7

'}, {'created': '2013-09-26 06:44:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix v3 server rebuild deserializer checking with wrong access_ip key

When rebuild server with xml format, the xml deserializer code
are checking with wrong key. So rebuilding with access_ips doesn't
make any effect. So correct the wrong key 'access_ipv4', 'access_ipv6'

commit_message:
Fix v3 server rebuild deserializer checking with wrong access_ip key

When rebuild server with xml format, the xml deserializer code
are checking with wrong key. So rebuilding with access_ips doesn't
make any effect. So correct the wrong key 'access_ipv4', 'access_ipv6'
to 'access_ip_v4', 'access_ip_v6'.

Change-Id: I8fccf3727f193bf9142dc814a76a32d5ab1a1b0a
Closes-bug: #1221646

commit_message:
Implement parser.Stack.__delitem__()

Allow the update code to delete old resources from the stack without
accessing the stack's resource attribute.

Change-Id: I9dbc623d7396dd84cdbee992fa91d88b6c01a0e5

keys/values/items directly instead of accessing the resources attribute.

"}]
commit_message:
Don't iterate over Stack.resources dictionary

Now that parser.Stack is a proper Mapping, we can iterate over its
keys/values/items directly instead of accessing the resources attribute.

Change-Id: I6bd9f357c21a0e75623a71543e981d3f4f87fcbe

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-05 13:55:27.000000000', 'message': "Refactor total_resources

Make the implementation slightly faster and more robust:

- Check that res.nested is callable
- Don't call res.nested() more than once
- Check for None explicitly
- Calculate totals directly, rather than with a for loop

Change-Id: Ib43cf5555620e54b9d4634e40cf46f75b50782ac
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor total_resources

Make the implementation slightly faster and more robust:

- Check that res.nested is callable
- Don't call res.nested() more than once
- Check for None explicitly
- Calculate totals directly, rather than with a for loop

Change-Id: Ib43cf5555620e54b9d4634e40cf46f75b50782ac

commit_message:
Fix docstring for disk_cachemodes

The docstring for the disk_cachemodes option implied a syntax that is
incorrect for a ListOpt.  Change the example to match exactly what you
would put in the config file for it to work.

Change-Id: Ie999d2799dba6c47facdc771e1cf6081d28d6b85
Closes-Bug: #1106423

commit_message:
Allow to set full url for endpoints

This changeset allows to set full url for endpoints. The default is
still to use the {public,admin,internal}_{protocol,host} and port
variables. The {public,admin,internal}_url parameters override the
_protocol, _host & port parameters.

There were previously one parameter for each {public,admin,internal}
endpoint url component (protocol, host), but not port.
Adding more parameters to allow different port would add too much
parameters and still missing the path part.

Fixes Bug#1227742

Change-Id: I834be8ab0f160b24348d218197711e8ecc392f5b

commit_message:
Close the cursor for SQLite for 034 upgrade/downgrade on select

The list() is needed around the table select for SQLite upgrade/downgrade
to work.  This forces a cursor close and prevents database locked errors.

closes-bug: 1233329
Change-Id: I01aedf9d2743a86881c124c9690f10233d9966bc

commit_message:
added card071 - creating cinder volumes

added three sections from the horizon admin guide. It also
includes updating and deleting volumes from horizon. cleaned
up whitespace in created and chapter files and user include
template

Change-Id: I7ae44fb9efe102a2c074ffbd758d4601f61c37d3
Implements: bp/training-manuals

commit_message:
Excessive creation of tokens w/ Neutron

In _get_auth_token, we should take advantage of the fact
that the token has an expiry datetime. We should save
the token and the expiry time and reuse the same token
for calls till the token expires

Partial-Bug: 1191159

Change-Id: I865b871562a642d71a463cb5bbdf3913c92e05b7

commit_message:
Add a example which uses a sqlite persistence layer

Add an example that will use a sqlite layer for
persisting flow and task information, and will use
the layer for future resumption.

Show how to output what a logbook contains as well.

Change-Id: If5f936fe100cb43ed857b99e3fae0c6e6baba5ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-27 16:44:48.000000000', 'message': 'Forced scheduling should be logged as Audit not Debug

Forced scheduling to a node is a privileged operation which bypasses
resource checks. As such the log entries should be Audit not Debug

Fixed Bug: 1231983

Change-Id: Id2016b7bf2ba5f7af4896b5f8df481437d2ee956
'}]
commit_message:
Forced scheduling should be logged as Audit not Debug

Forced scheduling to a node is a privileged operation which bypasses
resource checks. As such the log entries should be Audit not Debug

Fixed Bug: 1231983

Change-Id: Id2016b7bf2ba5f7af4896b5f8df481437d2ee956

commit_message:
assertEquals is deprecated, use assertEqual (H602)

Also change uses of assert_ to assertTrue() alongway.

Change-Id: Ic6edd1d89127ae9de5d101c0983adb4b927bfc0e

commit_message:
Catch up with upstream's changes to local_settings.py

In the past 6 months, quite a few things have changed upstream. It's
time to catch up and add the changes from local_settings.py.example.

Fixes: bug #1223317

Change-Id: I1fcabdf926263f1c6b6f19acd34ec59bf17283c3

commit_message:
Add flake8 hacking detecting

hacking is a plugin of flake8 for OpenStack. It should be listed in
test-requirements.txt.

pep8/pyflakes/flake8 are dependencies of hacking, will be installed
automatically, no need to list here.

Fixes Bug #1221101
Change-Id: Ief93edbc57d9fb4cb6260f93354c528979853e2d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 14:30:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix several login template translation issues

"permission" has no plural. Explicitly mention the thing were you don't
have access. It's not really translatable (to German at least)
otherwise. Lastly, the "home page" needs to be inside the translatable
string as it's location in the sentence doesn't have to be at the end.

Change-Id: I8e632ab511b8061c0d1a5b58245e03ce9cb87d5e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix several login template translation issues

"permission" has no plural. Explicitly mention the thing were you don't
have access. It's not really translatable (to German at least)
otherwise. Lastly, the "home page" needs to be inside the translatable
string as it's location in the sentence doesn't have to be at the end.

Change-Id: I8e632ab511b8061c0d1a5b58245e03ce9cb87d5e

Before we called 'power status; power on' in a loop which made the

commit_message:
Baremetal: Be more patient with IPMI and BMC

Before we called 'power status; power on' in a loop which made the
IPMI/BMCs not behave well.  Also the total time we would wait (2.5
seconds wasn't always enough).  So make sure power on/off is only called
once and wait up to 10 seconds for the power state change to go into
effect.

This patch has been tested on real baremetal using
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/TripleO/TripleOCloud

This bug is also linked to ironic so the change will be made there as
well.

Change-Id: I5a4d7c84ebdf9c1f7d8d0570dbc31764c31f1fc6
Closes-Bug: #1234479

commit_message:
Add a set of useful listeners

In order to understand how listeners are used it is pretty
nice to have a default set that do basic printing and logging
that can be used in debugging (or just as examples).

Include an example that uses this as well.

Fixes: bug 1224060

Change-Id: I7ba6e9dcbdca84d014b9d1f5054ce7a37eb766f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-14 01:05:01.000000000', 'message': 'Raise a linked exception when multiple failures

Instead of just reraising one of the potentially
many failures we should reraise the main exception
if its the only exception, otherwise we should raise
a linked exception that contains all the exceptions
that occurred.

Change-Id: I907a790f30d0f8104d69c0e90fd726be496d406f
'}]
commit_message:
Raise a linked exception when multiple failures

Instead of just reraising one of the potentially
many failures we should reraise the main exception
if its the only exception, otherwise we should raise
a linked exception that contains all the exceptions
that occurred.

Change-Id: I907a790f30d0f8104d69c0e90fd726be496d406f

commit_message:
Remove decorators and move to utils

In order to avoid the circular import
in threading utils move the decorators
functionality to utils/misc and move the
locking functionality to utils/lock_utils
and then use these functions from the
threading util (and elsewhere).

Fixes bug: 1236080

Change-Id: I9e71c2ba15782cbb6dd5ab7e1264b77ed47bc29e

commit_message:
Add reasons as to why the edges were created

Reasons are useful for later analysis when running
as to why the edge between two nodes was created so
when linking items in the graph it would be nice to
assign a reason.

Change-Id: I2185cf5fb3c2c07c0f5536d3b210080c6f61d5dd

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-10-03 22:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

The main disadvantage of this solution over mine [1] is that the backend socket won't get closed until the feeder side of the ArmyQueue times out.

So once the client disconnects you still have bytes sitting in the sockets buffer for app:proxy-server.client_timeout seconds (default 60).  But that's the nature of the ArmyQueue - to create a wall between the connection to the client and the connection to the backend servers.  I think a future patch should teardown that wall so we can reap backend connections as soon as the client disconnects now that we know how to do it reliably.

The advantage (and the reason this one should be merged and mine should NOT) is that handling it on the response object teardown (instead of on the client connection side) fixes it everywhere that GETorHEAD_base uses backend connections (including SegmentedIterable and the extra connections from X-newest).

FWIW, I think the unittest should have just been "fixed" to deal with the reality that all the backend connections which are not accepted to be read *will* (and most importantly SHOULD) receive a SIGPIPE when the connection is CLOSED rather than needlessly being drained i.e.

    diff --git a/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py b/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py
    index 85056cf..6e3400f 100644
    --- a/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py
    +++ b/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py
    @@ -713,7 +713,7 @@ class TestObjectController(unittest.TestCase):
                 res = req.get_response(prosrv)
                 self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 200)
                 self.assertEqual(res.body, obj)
    -            self.assertEqual(calls[0], 0)
    +            self.assertEqual(calls[0], 2)
             finally:
                 signal.signal(signal.SIGPIPE, old_handler)
     
But those tracebacks don't even show up in newer versions of eventlet (e.g. 0.13), so maybe it doesn't really matter.

It's somewhat interesting that with this change (asserting that SIGPIPE *was* received on the backend) the test actually provides a model for a test that would assert bug 1174660 is fixed, i.e. backend connections are CLOSED instead of drained:

    diff --git a/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py b/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py
    index 85056cf..d42b414 100644
    --- a/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py
    +++ b/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py
    @@ -30,6 +30,7 @@ from urllib import quote
     from hashlib import md5
     from tempfile import mkdtemp
     import weakref
    +import signal
     
     import mock
     from eventlet import sleep, spawn, wsgi, listen
    @@ -99,7 +100,7 @@ def setup():
         conf = {'devices': _testdir, 'swift_dir': _testdir,
                 'mount_check': 'false', 'allowed_headers':
                 'content-encoding, x-object-manifest, content-disposition, foo',
    -            'allow_versions': 'True'}
    +            'allow_versions': 'True', 'client_timeout': 1}
         prolis = listen(('localhost', 0))
         acc1lis = listen(('localhost', 0))
         acc2lis = listen(('localhost', 0))
    @@ -767,6 +768,46 @@ class TestObjectController(unittest.TestCase):
                 res = controller.PUT(req)
                 self.assertTrue(res.status.startswith('201 '))
     
    +    def test_GET_client_disconnect_closes_backend_connections(self):
    +        calls = [0]
    +
    +        def handler(_junk1, _junk2):
    +            calls[0] += 1
    +
    +        old_handler = signal.signal(signal.SIGPIPE, handler)
    +        try:
    +            prolis = _test_sockets[0]
    +            prosrv = _test_servers[0]
    +            sock = connect_tcp(('localhost', prolis.getsockname()[1]))
    +            fd = sock.makefile()
    +            obj = 'a' * (1024 * 1024)
    +            path = '/v1/a/c/o.large'
    +            fd.write('PUT %s HTTP/1.1\r\n'
    +                     'Host: localhost\r\n'
    +                     'Connection: close\r\n'
    +                     'X-Storage-Token: t\r\n'
    +                     'Content-Length: %s\r\n'
    +                     'Content-Type: application/octet-stream\r\n'
    +                     '\r\n%s' % (path, str(len(obj)), obj))
    +            fd.flush()
    +            headers = readuntil2crlfs(fd)
    +            exp = 'HTTP/1.1 201'
    +            self.assertEqual(headers[:len(exp)], exp)
    +            req = Request.blank(path,
    +                                environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': 'GET'},
    +                                headers={'Content-Type':
    +                                         'application/octet-stream',
    +                                         })
    +            res = req.get_response(prosrv)
    +            self.assertEqual(res.status_int, 200)
    +            for chunk in res.app_iter:
    +                break
    +            res.app_iter.close()
    +            sleep(2)
    +            self.assertEqual(calls[0], 2)
    +        finally:
    +            signal.signal(signal.SIGPIPE, old_handler)
    +
         def test_PUT_respects_write_affinity(self):
             written_to = []
     
Not a great test because of the sleep waiting on the client_timeout - but i'll leave a copy here for hysterical purposes and also as a troll for anyone who might still have the energy to investigate why there's two SIGPIPEs instead of only the expected one on what should be a normal client disconnect from a single backend server?

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/48190/'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-10-05 03:12:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

This looks good to me. I have not been able to find a problem with it, though I still fail to grok fully the depths of the objects we reach into from orbit.

@Clay seemed to bring up a good point about the client disconnect coming many seconds later. Here is a patch which addresses that, it works by having the client-side greenlet close the server-side source connection and then pulling one item from the queue to allow the server-side greenlet to notice its source was closed on it. See http://paste.openstack.org/show/47988/'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-10-07 18:01:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think that removing the queue entirely may be the right answer, but I'm very leery of making such a large change right before a release.

IMHO, we should fix this bug (whether with this patch or another) in a minimally-invasive way, then consider removing that queue once we've got a little more runway for testing."}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-10-07 21:59:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Approved

[{'created': '2013-09-26 23:31:42.000000000', 'message': "Stop reading from object server when client disconnects.

If a client were in the middle of an object GET request and then
disconnected, the proxy would wait a while (default 60s) and then time
out the connection. As part of the teardown for this, the proxy would
attempt to close the connection to the object server, then drain any
associated buffers. However, this didn't work particularly well,
resulting in the proxy reading the entire remainder of the object for
no gain.

Now, the proxy closes the connection hard, by calling .close() on the
underlying socket._socket object. This is different from calling
.close() on a socket._socketobject object, which is what you get back
from socket.socket() and similar methods. Calling .close() on a
socket._socketobject simply decrements a reference counter on the
socket._socket, which has been observed in the past to result in
socket leaks when something holds onto a reference. However, calling
.close() on a socket._socket actually closes the socket regardless of
who else has a reference to it.

I had to delete a test assertion that said the object server never got
SIGPIPE after a GET w/X-Newest. Well, you get a SIGPIPE when you write
to a closed socket, and now the proxy is actually closing the sockets
early, so now you *do* get a SIGPIPE.

closes-bug: 1174660

Note that this will cause a regression on bug 1037337; unfortunately,
the cure is worse than the disease, so out it goes.

Change-Id: I9c7a2e7fdb8b4232e53ea96f86b50e8d34c27221

commit_message:
Stop reading from object server when client disconnects.

If a client were in the middle of an object GET request and then
disconnected, the proxy would wait a while (default 60s) and then time
out the connection. As part of the teardown for this, the proxy would
attempt to close the connection to the object server, then drain any
associated buffers. However, this didn't work particularly well,
resulting in the proxy reading the entire remainder of the object for
no gain.

Now, the proxy closes the connection hard, by calling .close() on the
underlying socket._socket object. This is different from calling
.close() on a socket._socketobject object, which is what you get back
from socket.socket() and similar methods. Calling .close() on a
socket._socketobject simply decrements a reference counter on the
socket._socket, which has been observed in the past to result in
socket leaks when something holds onto a reference. However, calling
.close() on a socket._socket actually closes the socket regardless of
who else has a reference to it.

I had to delete a test assertion that said the object server never got
SIGPIPE after a GET w/X-Newest. Well, you get a SIGPIPE when you write
to a closed socket, and now the proxy is actually closing the sockets
early, so now you *do* get a SIGPIPE.

closes-bug: 1174660

Note that this will cause a regression on bug 1037337; unfortunately,
the cure is worse than the disease, so out it goes.

Change-Id: I9c7a2e7fdb8b4232e53ea96f86b50e8d34c27221

commit_message:
Fix entrypoints being updated/created by update.py

Previously entrypoints were not being created in the
target projects setup.cfg which means that the target
project would not be able to correctly use the taskflow
provided entrypoints. To fix this add a new helper
function to update.py that alters the entrypoint and
creates (or updates) the setup.cfg file where those
entrypoints are defined.

Fixes bug: 1235988

Change-Id: Ie32324c88e3c3642e58f3532e868f171f973d15e

commit_message:
Use predictable instance/volume names in test_volumes_actions

The setup method of test_volumes_actions generates a random name for the
instance and volume it uses for the tests but the names don't include
the test class so if they don't get cleaned up it's hard to debug where
they came from.  This patch simply adds the class name to the
instance/volume name generation.

Closes-Bug: #1235411

Change-Id: If457e73c11f08fd57ee77a85208de84fc39eda8c

commit_message:
Cleanup test_list_server_filters setup/teardown

The test_list_server_filters test class was doing a lot of
setup/teardown work that is now handled in the parent class. We still
have to explicitly set the name since some tests use it for filtering
but otherwise we can rely on the parent class to do most of the heavy
lifting here.

This change makes it so that the instances have a name based on the test
class rather than just a random integer which is hard to use for
debugging leaked instances.

This change also removes the get call from setup and moves it into the
test cases that actually need to use it (which are currently being
skipped anyway).

Closes-Bug: 1235411

Change-Id: I66813c900059dd4232de645c225032e58e9aecde

commit_message:
Add addtional logging and catch exceptions

Sometimes the nightly stress test run fails. This will catch all
exceptions in run_stress.py and log them.

Change-Id: Ib6abd2c157df3988ccae1c6c8f703ec0ed24ff00
Fixes-bug: 1234580

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-07 16:11:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add ovs-dpctl-top tool for better troubleshooting

Nicira added a tool to emulate top for ovs-dpctl output
in this commit:

http://git.openvswitch.org/cgi-bin/gitweb.cgi?p=openvswitch;a=commit;h=14b4c575c28421d1181b509dbeae6e4849c7da69

This tool allows you to quickly, and in real time, get better insight
into what the traffic looks like on any given OVS node.

This is especially useful on L3 agent (logical router) nodes as it
will allow you to pinpoint trouble flows/links/ips which may be
causing bottlenecks or consuming an inordinate amount of CPU.

Change-Id: I54c9e6e86ce0942c206227b45123d17ca27109be
'}]
commit_message:
Add ovs-dpctl-top tool for better troubleshooting

Nicira added a tool to emulate top for ovs-dpctl output
in this commit:

http://git.openvswitch.org/cgi-bin/gitweb.cgi?p=openvswitch;a=commit;h=14b4c575c28421d1181b509dbeae6e4849c7da69

This tool allows you to quickly, and in real time, get better insight
into what the traffic looks like on any given OVS node.

This is especially useful on L3 agent (logical router) nodes as it
will allow you to pinpoint trouble flows/links/ips which may be
causing bottlenecks or consuming an inordinate amount of CPU.

Change-Id: I54c9e6e86ce0942c206227b45123d17ca27109be

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-07 14:56:07.000000000', 'message': 'Parameterize agent report timers

* Ensure that report_interval and agent_down_time
are both parameters that can be overriden
* Relax the default agent_down_time to 15 seconds
since 4 seconds (1 second > report_interval) proves

commit_message:
Parameterize agent report timers

* Ensure that report_interval and agent_down_time
are both parameters that can be overriden
* Relax the default agent_down_time to 15 seconds
since 4 seconds (1 second > report_interval) proves
unreliable with a large number of routers

Change-Id: Id9bfcd01ba36553b4fb1371238d58de77435a9aa
