commit_message:
Add takeover delay to quantum-ha-tool

Add a takeover delay to the quantum-ha-tool to ensure we do
not try to aggressively takeover.  We want to ensure an agent
is offline for some period of time (TAKEOVER_DELAY seconds)
before we begin a migration.  We also randomize it a bit in the
event that this script is being run in parallel from several hosts.

Change-Id: Ied9a75791b27af310f81f4cec327b3699fbae7ed

commit_message:
calculate the tenants to be registered programmatically

The tenants are now derived from the users hash. Previously the tenants
list had to be provided independently which could cause user errors.

This should also make it easier for wrapper cookbooks which don't have
to calculate the tenants themselves from the users list.

Change-Id: If3ad9840f5b224fa2938a6288df929385335ea38

commit_message:
Fix races in v3 cells extension tests

A global was used for a cell list and tests would update this global
and fail depending on order run, etc.

Yes, this is the same fix as commit bb2c3c5 except for the v3
extension. Yes, copied and pasted code is utterly evil. No, we
apparently will never learn.

Closes-Bug: #1235399
Change-Id: I3406d0440aed38cbf3a9bedf24420fb867876b08

subject: Revert "Make Messages unicode before hitting logging"
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-04 20:39:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-oslo-incubator-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/29/49829/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/e32f008 : SUCCESS in 2m 01s
- gate-oslo-incubator-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/29/49829/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/50c4956/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 35s
- gate-oslo-incubator-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/29/49829/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/5d501a5 : SUCCESS in 3m 09s
- gate-oslo-incubator-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/29/49829/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/2b39708 : SUCCESS in 2m 54s
'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-10-04 20:51:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not entirely sure this should be removed.  Seems like it provides a safety net for the logging code in case we pass it something else it can't handle.  I'm open to discussion though."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-10-04 22:38:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I would also prefer to leave the safety net.

What's the motivation for removing it?"}, {'account_id': 7996, 'date': '2013-10-07 02:34:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Doug, As far as this being a safety net there is really nothing to protect against. The translation features (lazy translation) are turned off, and this fix was only intended to be a work around for the logging issue so we could merge lazy t9n in Havana. At this point, it is effectively dead code, not sure why it was merged tbh since there was no intention to enable lazy translation. Thank you,'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-10-07 15:14:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Except that this isn't specific to Messages the way it's written.  It will catch any non-basestring object and coerce it to unicode.  Which, given the poor handling of objects that resolve to unicode in the logging module, seems like a worthwhile thing to do regardless of whether the Message class is enabled."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-10-07 16:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks, Ben, that was exactly my point.'}, {'account_id': 7996, 'date': '2013-10-07 16:48:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Ben and Doug, That logging module has been there forever, and before the Message issue (which I think can be handled differently) there was no evidence of that logging issue affecting anything else. IMO this is a ghost fix, in that it really isn't fixing anything. If an issue ever comes up I think it can be addressed, but I think it's important to remember the history of this particular commit and how it was meant to be a workaround particularly for Messages. It really isn't fixing anything at this point really. Thank you,"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-10-07 16:58:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is addressing a shortcoming in the Python logging module - namely the fact that it calls str() on objects that may resolve to unicode data.  This is a good thing to have even if we aren't using Messages.

TBH, at this point I'm not entirely convinced that we need a further fix for Messages beyond this, so I think we should table this until we've had a chance to meet about that."}, {'account_id': 7996, 'date': '2013-10-07 20:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Sounds good Ben.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-04 20:35:57.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Make Messages unicode before hitting logging"

This reverts commit 572cfecb4da5c618a407b8de2a7feae9c3f35ce4.

The commit being reverted was sent as a workaround for bug #1225099
however the translation features were ultimately completely turned off,
and so the workaround ended up not being needed and it is actually
unnecessary code.

We will try to find a better solution for the bug and we'll send it when
the translation features are turned back on.

Change-Id: If690d8ba6351bcacd77fe15454b2c536e3213273
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Make Messages unicode before hitting logging"

This reverts commit 572cfecb4da5c618a407b8de2a7feae9c3f35ce4.

The commit being reverted was sent as a workaround for bug #1225099
however the translation features were ultimately completely turned off,
and so the workaround ended up not being needed and it is actually
unnecessary code.

We will try to find a better solution for the bug and we'll send it when
the translation features are turned back on.

Change-Id: If690d8ba6351bcacd77fe15454b2c536e3213273

commit_message:
Include ML2 plugin documentation

Add ML2 plugin references and description
Include VXLAN as provider network
Add a deprecation note for openvswitch and linuxbridge plugins

Fix bug #1230283

Change-Id: I5710f81601fdb04b752737dfa0f36fc7863cca9e

commit_message:
Allow access by index

Since a linear flow is a linear set of tasks or subflows
we can easily add in an accessor that can fetch these
items by index which is useful for indexing for any
post-add operations.

Change-Id: Ib1690584a08e24fae29285225e6c519b06ce2ddd

commit_message:
Validate each flow state change

When engine changing state, the transition is now validated. This
helps to avoid complex and error prone checks in engine._change_state
and make validating code more reusable in different engines.

Change-Id: I2a06823c532926bb3bd034f7252b14bdbbc1fa1d
Implements: bp:transition-control

[{'created': '2013-10-07 12:47:14.000000000', 'message': 'Update state sequence for failed flows

When flow failes, it now transitions to FAILURE state, and then
goes throgh REVERTING to REVERTED. So, flows that failed and were
reverted are now left in REVERTED state.

Change-Id: Ieb9135673847eb4942afa61696975d013b809819
'}]
commit_message:
Update state sequence for failed flows

When flow failes, it now transitions to FAILURE state, and then
goes throgh REVERTING to REVERTED. So, flows that failed and were
reverted are now left in REVERTED state.

Change-Id: Ieb9135673847eb4942afa61696975d013b809819

commit_message:
Bump requirements to the latest

Match the requirements for taskflow with
the openstack requirements (note the upstream
requirements are missing 'futures' and 'networkx')
and update the new hacking violations that were
detected due to the hacking requirement version
bump.

Change-Id: I8d1326cf2a8b1ea062f5e9aacd0c4f8261c6531a

(5 inline comments)

Great, Diane! I love how this goes all in one place and hope we can do further move of content from the books' pom.xml files to the doc/pom.xml one.

I've noticed a couple of issues with your patch, could you fix those, please? Once those are fixed, I would like to give a +10 since I really love this!

Once that is done, you can run "mvn generate-sources" from the doc directory. This is a nice unexpected plus of your change!

You need https://review.openstack.org/#/c/49911/ to get this validated.'}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-10-07 15:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-10-07 15:35:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This is not used anywhere.

Thanks, I didn't think about storing the uuid in binary like this.

On my MBP, it takes ~3 us to encode a canonical UUID string, and ~9 us to encode it into bytes. So that's about 12 us added to each message post and listing. 

That seems OK, given it allows us to push fewer bits over the wire and means fewer bits to schlep around in the DB."}, {'account_id': 6427, 'date': '2013-10-04 20:20:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
feat(api): Client-ID as a real UUID

We store the UUID in binary form in DBs, and perform checking
on user inputs.  Compared with the hex form we currently using,
the binary form saves half space to store.  In addition, by
enforcing UUID on the server side, we can minimize the chance of
client ID collision.

Change-Id: Ic3048a0d2aa21bd201e2d2d9cd8a562662cf8f8e
Closes-Bug: 1233420

commit_message:
feat(api): give validation resp a different title

HTTPBadRequestBody should only be used to indicate the errors
with content body, while input validation errors should be
regarded as violations on API calling conventions.

Change-Id: I23990f58ff3233fe1cf4febad77efe0173027a33

commit_message:
MidoNet plugin, clean up dhcp entries correctly

When a subnet gets deleted, remove the proper dhcp entry, not
always the first one.

Change-Id: I4f152eed5a7dd408bda866cb304838989bdc363c
Solves-bug: #1233259

commit_message:
Add flag to make baremetal.pxe file injection optional

File injection is slow and risky, So make it optional. File injection
was used for getting networking configuration into the baremetal nodes,
but neutron can do this now. File injection is also used for general
file injection and password injection, but those should be optional as
well.

Change-Id: If59641952255e5aaf3767524e2b3c566eefe2b74
Related-Bug: #1178103

commit_message:
Swift store add should not use wildcard raise

When there is an yield block in an except clause prior to wildcard raise,
if the thread is re-scheduled, the raise generates a TypeError.
Since the caught exception has NoneType, it causes a wrong exception(NoneType)
to be raised.

Fixes bug #1226258

Change-Id: I6ce56d1943535279f2ad40c7978b1539ed638d57

commit_message:
Fix V3 API flavor returning empty string for attributes

Fixes cases where in the V3 API the ephemeral, swap and vcpus
attributes for flavors were returned as the empty string
when they had a value of 0. Also removes default setting for
the disabled attribute as it is always set in the db.

Fixes up some associated testcase data as it was using data which
could not exist in the db.

Change-Id: I90f48956411f792037b1cd744c4fa8d287f9e752
Closes-Bug: #1216929

commit_message:
Adds v3 API samples for hide server addresses and keypairs

Adds the v3 API samples for the hide server addresses and
keypairs extensions. Bundled together to reduce review load

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-specification

+DocImpact

commit_message:
Adds V3 API samples for srvcs, tenant usage, server_diagnostics

Adds V3 API samples for the services, simple tenant usage and
server_diagnostics extensions. Bundling them together to save
on review load

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests
Partially implements blueprint v3-api-specification

Change-Id: I91edc6500acbe92221427383b4bcd3d00a8faadd

commit_message:
Assert backing_file should exist before attempting to create it

Fixes bug 1200249

Change-Id: If7878361711f835247aaf64ce26f0058f8c4b5ba
(cherry picked from commit 879565efe51f19bd6f4d69d1b430b995f62106c8)

Another question on whether we need vertica in the public code.

Also, if the intention of this is to start > 1 manager using this binscript, i wrote some code that does this. See [1] for the proper way to do this. The ServiceLauncher handles the killing of all services via signals and such, so its better than just starting indep. processes like the binscript is doing now.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/bin/cinder-volume'}, {'account_id': 8309, 'date': '2013-08-12 07:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-12 07:49:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Making the DB specific settings configurable that will help in addition/removal/modification dynamically and in some cases may help in defining these settings per environment.'}, {'account_id': 1925, 'date': '2013-08-13 00:13:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We need a way to load a single Manager (one that may not be in listed in SERVICE_REGISTRY). We discussed this in our IRC meeting.  It was agreed that having a dynamic approach to loading Managers was indeed what we want.  At some point, we can consider pushing the service_type as part of the guest_info file, which will allow reuse of guestagent.conf across service_types.'}, {'account_id': 1925, 'date': '2013-09-09 18:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-09-10 13:29:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Service Registration using conf file

Making the DB specific settings for Service
Registry configuration driven that will help
in addition/removal/modification dynamically
for new service type.

Format for adding new service type in guestagen
config file will be -
service_registry_ext  = <add service type in dictonary>

implements: blueprint configuration-driven-changes

Change-Id: I0fc1a80f0fa70dbc0c477e31b5374d156bb03488

commit_message:
Add a tripleo-cd for CD deploying an overcloud.

This isn't perfect, but it should be a decent enough starting point.

Change-Id: I67d397d37690d8e9d9596b22101baf9fe8be2762

commit_message:
Move call to _default_block_device_names() inside try block

During instance builds, a call to _default_block_device_names() is
made which contains a db call to update the instance. In case the
instance is gone it will throw an unhandled InstanceNotFound exception.

To properly handle this, move the call to _default_block_device_names()
inside the existing try block next to it that handles this exception.

Change-Id: I3503029f02669e6ae31441653096fa69cba76d45
Closes-Bug: #1224677

commit_message:
Overwrite passwords in devtest_*

If we don't use this flag, running devtest twice results in an unusable
cloud and a stalled build. Using --overwrite just makes sense for
iterating on devtest.

Change-Id: If1c4f73cd5cb1d2888505bf3d1eba855ee6b5a94

commit_message:
baremetal: Fix misuse of "instance" parameter of attach/detach_volume

Some parts of baremetal driver treat "instance" parameter as if it is
the name of an instance, but actually it is the instance itself (dict).

Closes-Bug: #1221244
Change-Id: I01a296a6ac0bbf7c5fec3434ddf1197828b849b6

[{'created': '2013-10-07 16:12:17.000000000', 'message': "bug: proxy headers aren't forwarded properly

The proxy currently forwards headers in WSGI format,
e.g. 'Content_Length', vs. 'Content-Length'. This breaks any standards
conforming HTTP server that's placed in between the proxy and
marconi-queues endpoints (for partitioning). This patch cannonicalizes
headers before they are forwarded to resolve this issue.

Change-Id: I1eab83dbb1fb9cfec5d15d40830e383da4e6591e

commit_message:
bug: proxy headers aren't forwarded properly

The proxy currently forwards headers in WSGI format,
e.g. 'Content_Length', vs. 'Content-Length'. This breaks any standards
conforming HTTP server that's placed in between the proxy and
marconi-queues endpoints (for partitioning). This patch cannonicalizes
headers before they are forwarded to resolve this issue.

Change-Id: I1eab83dbb1fb9cfec5d15d40830e383da4e6591e

commit_message:
Host aggregate configuration throws exception

If the virtualization driver did not implement the host
aggregate support functions (add_to_aggregate,
remove_from_aggregate and undo_aggregate_operation) then an
exception is thrown when a host aggregate was created/deleted.
Configuration of the host aggregates breaks tempest tests when
the underlying driver does not have these methods implemented.

The only driver that actually uses this is the Xen driver.
The solution enables all drivers to support this without
having to add in specific code. More specifically, the compute
manager will not raise NotImplementedError.

Closes-Bug: 1229912
Closes-Bug: 1229911

Change-Id: Iee69e45d94047742b6a499a139bac96ad9dd971f

I added back the dependency on this patch from the child patch so we have that recorded now. Sorry for losing track of that.

@Brant: The fix that depends on this refactor has a fairly comprehensive test suite associated with the confirm_token_not_expired() function. Normally I'd agree that we should add tests here so no change goes untested, however the complexities of timezones make this function as it is currently written (before the upcoming fix) very fragile. Basically, the tests would work as long as the machine running them is set to UTC. In other words, the tests would fail for any developer who's machine is not in UTC time. The patch that depends on this refactor corrects this problem both for testing & for production use.

This refactor was originally part of the patch containing the fix but it was later suggested we split out the refactor to its own patch."}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-09-06 15:47:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

The tests that should be added are:

 1) that _token_is_v2() is true if given a v2 token
 2) that _token_is_v2() is False if given a v3 token
 3) that _token_is_v3() is true if given a v3 token
 4) that _token_is_v3() is False if given a v2 token

I'm OK with the tests for the timestamp/UTC stuff going in the other submission."}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2013-09-06 17:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Refactor for testability of an upcoming change

confirm_token_not_expired() in keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py has
been moved out of the class to make it a function and be more testable.
Currently, there is no need to keep it within the class. An upcoming
commit makes fixes that rely on this refactor to be tested.

Change-Id: I8460a2ee663dec8be0f339735208779a3b988040

messages:

People were interested in looking at this; it's definitely not ready to merge, though. This diff is purely for educational purposes."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-10-01 18:05:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-10-01 18:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-10-01 18:05:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2013-10-01 18:17:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Right now I can generate ring-collisions if I know the endcap.  I can do that just as easily for SHA-1 or something else as well.


MD5 is used as a function to evenly spread objects across partitions in a way that an external entity can't trivially exploit to create a hot-spot in the partition space.

For this it still seems to perform quite well, in fact you could use a lesser function and it would be good enough, but we already have md5 so why change?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-01 18:49:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-01 17:49:00.000000000', 'message': "Make hash algorithm configurable for new rings.

While it is true that there are currently no second-preimage attacks
against MD5, there are other attacks that weaken it, and it's not like
MD5 is going to get any stronger.

Now you can give a different hash algorithm to `swift-ring-builder
create` on the command line, and all your object paths will get hashed
with the new algorithm. On-disk filenames will reflect the new hash.

You can't change an existing ring's hash algorithm. I mean, you *can*,
but you'll lose all your data.

This works by having the proxy (a) pay attention to the ring's hash
algorithm when hashing paths, and (b) extract the hash algorithm from
the rings and pass it to the backend servers via HTTP headers so they
can hash paths the same way. If the header is missing, the backends
will default to md5, so upgrades of existing clusters will work.

Note that there's a use of MD5 in Ring.get_more_nodes() that's been
left there intentionally. It doesn't affect on-disk placement, only
handoff selection, and it operates on the partition number that comes
from the configurable hash anyway. Changing that wouldn't actually
gain us anything.

Change-Id: I48eb975ac3c252294f365d19f7aaff96c507b468
"}, {'created': '2013-10-01 18:05:36.000000000', 'message': "Make hash algorithm configurable for new rings.

While it is true that there are currently no second-preimage attacks
against MD5, there are other attacks that weaken it, and it's not like
MD5 is going to get any stronger.

Now you can give a different hash algorithm to `swift-ring-builder
create` on the command line, and all your object paths will get hashed
with the new algorithm. On-disk filenames will reflect the new hash.

You can't change an existing ring's hash algorithm. I mean, you *can*,
but you'll lose all your data.

This works by having the proxy (a) pay attention to the ring's hash
algorithm when hashing paths, and (b) extract the hash algorithm from
the rings and pass it to the backend servers via HTTP headers so they
can hash paths the same way. If the header is missing, the backends
will default to md5, so upgrades of existing clusters will work.

Note that there's a use of MD5 in Ring.get_more_nodes() that's been
left there intentionally. It doesn't affect on-disk placement, only
handoff selection, and it operates on the partition number that comes
from the configurable hash anyway. Changing that wouldn't actually
gain us anything.

Note: doesn't work on py2.6, it seems. Who knew?

Change-Id: I48eb975ac3c252294f365d19f7aaff96c507b468
"}]
commit_message:
Make hash algorithm configurable for new rings.

While it is true that there are currently no second-preimage attacks
against MD5, there are other attacks that weaken it, and it's not like
MD5 is going to get any stronger.

Now you can give a different hash algorithm to `swift-ring-builder
create` on the command line, and all your object paths will get hashed
with the new algorithm. On-disk filenames will reflect the new hash.

You can't change an existing ring's hash algorithm. I mean, you *can*,
but you'll lose all your data.

This works by having the proxy (a) pay attention to the ring's hash
algorithm when hashing paths, and (b) extract the hash algorithm from
the rings and pass it to the backend servers via HTTP headers so they
can hash paths the same way. If the header is missing, the backends
will default to md5, so upgrades of existing clusters will work.

Note that there's a use of MD5 in Ring.get_more_nodes() that's been
left there intentionally. It doesn't affect on-disk placement, only
handoff selection, and it operates on the partition number that comes
from the configurable hash anyway. Changing that wouldn't actually
gain us anything.

Note: doesn't work on py2.6, it seems. Who knew?

Change-Id: I48eb975ac3c252294f365d19f7aaff96c507b468

commit_message:
Change rpc_support_old_agents default to False

Changes the rpc_support_old_agents config variable default value to
False, so that the vlan_id field (redundant with the segmentation_id
field) is no longer included in RPC messages from the linuxbridge and
mlnx plugins to their corresponding L2 agents. This can be set to True
if needed to support L2 agents older than midway through the havana
cycle.

Closes-Bug: 1235323
Change-Id: I919824c5b02e28e3563e64e98bb106bf722327ec

commit_message:
Create v1 package and move messages there

The patch creates a v1 package where the client v1 API will reside. The
patch also moves messages.py out from transport/http into this new
package.

Implements blueprint python-marconiclient-v1

Change-Id: Ib11eabc44c0df8867e884b4eafe65f266c6e3ef0

commit_message:
Fix HTTP response for PortNotFound during boot (v3 API)

If a non-existent Neutron port is passed as a network parameter during create
instance, Nova API should return a 404 error. This was fixed for the V2
API in commit 4721408ea861a66af1ad1df5a45c42addcd8a95f (though with a 400).
This applies the corresponding fix to the V3 API.

Fixes bug 1212137

Change-Id: I27dfba636635eb8ac257785b833b240bc439f9ff

commit_message:
Return a NetworkInfo object instead of a list

This return a NetworkInfo object instead of a list when there are no
configured networks available.

Fixes bug #1222781

Change-Id: I59c88944253ed5ff8b567d79046c3065fdfed9ab

commit_message:
Update allowvssprovider in xenstore_data

My previous commit was missing the vm-data part so the original
bug was still present.

The command line fix:
xe vm-param-set uuid={UUID} xenstore-data:vm-data/allowvssprovider=false

This commit adds vm-data to the xenstore message and will properly
disallow vss.

Fixes: bug #1112673

Change-Id: I85ef25a9b61795c98c12549f77cd7ca7305861d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-05 00:12:19.000000000', 'message': 'Clone volume with right size with SolidFire

It is possible to clone a volume with a size greater than
the source volume. When using the SolidFire driver, the volume size
was not passed in the call made to the SolidFire API when
cloning a volume.

It resulted in a cloned volume having the same size as the source
volume but the correct size in the Cinder database.

This changes makes sure the cloned volume has the correct size
by explicitly passing the requested size when calling
the SolidFire API and cloning the volume.

Fixes: bug #1219105
Change-Id: I5628c7fa922780d6b0601e2daa79310a61085edc
(cherry picked from commit 0a87ff988cd21586daeb6ed886e44aedaa49c320)
'}]
commit_message:
Clone volume with right size with SolidFire

It is possible to clone a volume with a size greater than
the source volume. When using the SolidFire driver, the volume size
was not passed in the call made to the SolidFire API when
cloning a volume.

It resulted in a cloned volume having the same size as the source
volume but the correct size in the Cinder database.

This changes makes sure the cloned volume has the correct size
by explicitly passing the requested size when calling
the SolidFire API and cloning the volume.

Fixes: bug #1219105
Change-Id: I5628c7fa922780d6b0601e2daa79310a61085edc
(cherry picked from commit 0a87ff988cd21586daeb6ed886e44aedaa49c320)

commit_message:
Fix skip_because decorator

If we use skip_because decorator, the below error occurs.
 _StringException: ImportError: Failed to import test module:...
And, all tests of the class having the skip_because decorator are not
tested.
This commit fixes it.

Change-Id: I98e51d3bfd8b13dc3ef462eb92b170295f5f142e
Closes-Bug: #1236220

Today I learned some things:

First, there's one file with some vim formatting directives at the top, and 3 with emacs-format python directives for "this is utf8".

Second, we're pretty inconsistent with whether or not our test files have shebang lines or not.

Third, as I learned when I went to fix it, I don't care at all about the shebang lines in test files. Who knew? :)

Fourth, viewing the Nth file in a diff takes longer than viewing the 1st file. I think there's some O(N) stuff going on in Gerrit. I recommend that, if anyone else looks at this, they use the gitweb link. Otherwise, loading this diff file-by-file will take all damn day.'}, {'account_id': 7882, 'date': '2013-10-01 06:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
NEC plugin: Fix nec-agent unexpected exit due to RPC exception

Changes nec-agent to catch RPC exceptions in the main
daemon loop. It fixes the following two bugs.

- nec-agent dies with RPC timeout in secgroup RPC
  (Closes-Bug: #1235106)

- port_added message can be dropped when RPC timeout occurs
  (Closes-Bug: #1235111). Moves exception catch from PluginApi
  to the main daemon loop.

Change-Id: I12394b739fc35bff271543f4625c5e3152e534ae

[{'created': '2013-10-07 14:47:45.000000000', 'message': 'Improve healthcheck tab to send cluster id

Requests on healthcheck tab doesnot send cluster id
with get /tests and get /testsets

We need this functionality to enable conditional discovering of tests

Change-Id: Ib37546ff95334ddf2ea090c4ebcc8443e04182d5
'}]
commit_message:
Improve healthcheck tab to send cluster id

Requests on healthcheck tab doesnot send cluster id
with get /tests and get /testsets

We need this functionality to enable conditional discovering of tests

Change-Id: Ib37546ff95334ddf2ea090c4ebcc8443e04182d5

Allow removing Node Group while scaling

Now "-" button allows do decrease count to 0.

Change-Id: Iaa974019c027fca75c815d3dbec1bc76b19be23f
Fixes: bug #1233629

commit_message:
Allow job binaries to be retrieved from internal swift

* also adds job-binaries/<id>/data to REST api
* limit the size of job binary data retrieved from swift or the internal db

Fixes: bug #1228128
Change-Id: Ib0278d7aee334b628089b7108c5bd437845ceaee

Implement deploy and tear_down conductor methods

in conductor/manager and conductor/rpcapi.

commit_message:
Make rally.utils.import_modules_from_package recursive

We should import all modules and submodules of package.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-04 17:06:58.000000000', 'message': 'rearrange Ceph storage options in OpenStack settings and setup wizard

On CentOS and Ubuntu, present a list of checkboxes to enable LVM and/or
Ceph for volumes, Ceph for images, and Swift and/or Ceph for objects,
with all checkboxes off by default. On RHOS, Ceph options are disabled
in the wizard and absent from the settings tab.

Change-Id: Ic23778b8e400cd19a00384aa8fa5c9e84cc614f0
'}, {'created': '2013-10-04 23:40:41.000000000', 'message': "rearrange Ceph storage options

In the settings tab and in the backend, represent storage settings as
five true/false toggles instead of two enum based radio selectors, so
that multiple or no storage backends can be configured where applicable.

In setup wizard, keep the radio selectors for Cinder and Glance
backends, set corresponding toggles based on the selection, and keep
object storage backend options unchecked by default.

For release that doesn't have ceph-osd role defined (RHOS), all Ceph
options are disabled in the wizard and absent from the settings tab.

Change-Id: Ic23778b8e400cd19a00384aa8fa5c9e84cc614f0
"}, {'created': '2013-10-07 06:15:35.000000000', 'message': "rearrange Ceph storage options

In the settings tab and in the backend, represent storage settings as
five true/false toggles instead of two enum based radio selectors, so
that multiple or no storage backends can be configured where applicable.

In setup wizard, keep the radio selectors for Cinder and Glance
backends, set corresponding toggles based on the selection, and keep
object storage backend options unchecked by default.

For release that doesn't have ceph-osd role defined (RHOS), all Ceph
options are disabled in the wizard and absent from the settings tab.

Change-Id: Ic23778b8e400cd19a00384aa8fa5c9e84cc614f0
"}]
commit_message:
rearrange Ceph storage options

In the settings tab and in the backend, represent storage settings as
five true/false toggles instead of two enum based radio selectors, so
that multiple or no storage backends can be configured where applicable.

In setup wizard, keep the radio selectors for Cinder and Glance
backends, set corresponding toggles based on the selection, and keep
object storage backend options unchecked by default.

For release that doesn't have ceph-osd role defined (RHOS), all Ceph
options are disabled in the wizard and absent from the settings tab.

Change-Id: Ic23778b8e400cd19a00384aa8fa5c9e84cc614f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-04 17:03:26.000000000', 'message': 'cephjournal mount point, file system, min size

 * remove mount point from cephjournal volume definition
 * use generator for min size instead of hardcoded 0
 * change file system from xfs to ext4 for better performance
 * change type from raid to partition for Ubuntu

Change-Id: I86c7a03fea6cc808820962a04734468680ef2b71
'}]
commit_message:
cephjournal mount point, file system, min size

 * remove mount point from cephjournal volume definition
 * use generator for min size instead of hardcoded 0
 * change file system from xfs to ext4 for better performance
 * change type from raid to partition for Ubuntu

Change-Id: I86c7a03fea6cc808820962a04734468680ef2b71

[{'created': '2013-08-28 04:18:36.000000000', 'message': "fix the an Unexpected API Error issue in flavor API

this fix the bug 1217679. The flavors.add_flavor_access
and flavors.remove_flavor_access require admin privilege
in DB level but the policy doesn't require it and the exception
isn't catched in the api. So the bug arise. The privilege check
in DB level is not necessary, but it need more tests and can be
remove in other patch or blue-print.

This also check the return of authorize in index of
FlavorAccessController, and raise exception. Although
it's always True according to the current policy set.

Change-Id: I0b1231f47fffaf99f330de02956bfe8d7cd4b920

commit_message:
fix the an Unexpected API Error issue in flavor API

The flavors.add_flavor_access and flavors.remove_flavor_access
require admin privilege in DB level but the policy doesn't
require it and the exception isn't catched in the api. So the
bug arise. The privilege check in DB level is not necessary,
but it need more tests and can be remove in other patch or
blue-print.

This use extension_authorizer instead of soft_extension_authorizer
in the action of flavor_access, in order to raise exception.

Closes-Bug: #1217679
DocImpact

Change-Id: I0b1231f47fffaf99f330de02956bfe8d7cd4b920

commit_message:
Refactor common/utils methods to common/ondisk

Place all the methods related to on-disk layout and / or configuration
into a new common module that can be shared by the various modules
using the same on-disk layout.

Change-Id: I27ffd4665d5115ffdde649c48a4d18e12017e6a9
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
tempest/config.py parse some sections incorrectly

Two issues for tempest/config.py:
1. When parsing sections of object-storage and dashboard,
   wrong variable is used.
2. We'd better rename BotoConfig/ObjectStoreConfig
   to BotoGroup/ObjectStoreGroup

 Closes-Bug: #1231595

Change-Id: I0d3162708237211ce7beb4a651f11db57d4d5e44

commit_message:
Wait 14 minutes for the overcloud to deploy.

It takes 8 minutes in the CD cloud for heat to do it's job, so we're
then timing out during sql patch application etc.

Change-Id: I13773527ed70bafe91ee6f09abafc877c08b5ae7

commit_message:
Add support for multiple HDP versions

This is the first commit in a series of commits to support multiple
HDP versions.  There will more than likely be subsequent commits
to account for discoveries during the actual inclusion of new
versions or if the level of abstraction is deemed inappropriate etc.

implements blueprint hdp-version-support

Change-Id: I7a94753b18920a9a1052123da9528c47ff47db7a

commit_message:
Make pull-tools avoid offering to merge

In OpenStack we don't allow merge commits, and it probably isn't what
we would want even if we did allow them. Also, if we are on a branch,
we are going to assume the user does not want to even attempt a pull.

If the user is on master, and has diverged, we want to offer them a
likely next step, which is to rebase on origin/master.

Change-Id: I446394505d82bc30af6ead0d7dd1a6e11fe1e7b7

commit_message:
Imply --one-time when --force is used

Without this change, if a user runs os-collect-config --force, it will
lock the user in an infinite loop running the command over and over with
very little chance to cancel. There are no compelling use cases for that
behavior, but it is extremely inconvenient, so implying --one-time
improves usability of os-collect-config for users.

Change-Id: Ia8c9bf0bf97ab9e40e465c947c2f0cbeb981c08e

commit_message:
add more test cases to improve the test code coverage #4

In this patch, the following module test coverage improved to 100%

ceilometer/alarm/evaluator/__init__

Since the module defines an abstract class, it is important to
change the abstract method body from using "pass" to comments so
that the test coverage can possibly to be ushed to 100%. If the
abstract method body is the "pass" statement, then the test code
coverage can not be possibly 100% since abstract class can not
be instantiated, thus can not be tested.

Change-Id: Icaac1e45a695544d9c22fd5d20b79616d2e4d504

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-04 19:28:33.000000000', 'message': 'chore: Designate semi-private "friend" helper methods as such

This patch implements flaper87's suggestion from several weeks ago
to either define ancillary storage driver methods in the ABC, or
to treat them as "semi-private" and rename them to include an
underscore in the front.

I took the one method that was implemented by both storage drivers, first(),
and formally defined it in the ABC. The remaining mongo helper methods
that support other controller classes within the same driver (i.e.,
"friend" classes) were given the canonical "_" prefix.

Change-Id: I6b4f8ab7f961a621bf85e122ef7e33a3c1084f8f
'}]
commit_message:
chore: Designate semi-private "friend" helper methods as such

This patch implements flaper87's suggestion from several weeks ago
to either define ancillary storage driver methods in the ABC, or
to treat them as "semi-private" and rename them to include an
underscore in the front.

I took the one method that was implemented by both storage drivers, first(),
and formally defined it in the ABC. The remaining mongo helper methods
that support other controller classes within the same driver (i.e.,
"friend" classes) were given the canonical "_" prefix.

Change-Id: I6b4f8ab7f961a621bf85e122ef7e33a3c1084f8f

commit_message:
Remove extraneous vim configuration comments

Fixes bug # 1229324

Remove line containing

comment - # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4

at the top of source code files, except for files in
ceilometer/openstack/common and bin/ceilometer-rpc-zmq-receiver

Change-Id: Ic8643afbc3510c36c41871b8a840a9b9e21eaba7

commit_message:
Add notifications for alarm changes

Changes in alarm state (including definition and deletion) now
emit notifications.

Change-Id: I55799d6f00e6832c1d7ffb736f97d3dfcbe801aa

should not check that file or use it for building.

This showed also books were not build since changes to pom.xml

commit_message:
Handle changes of tools or pom.xml, ignore doc/pom.xml

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/49888/ introduces doc/pom.xml, we
should not check that file or use it for building.

This showed also books were not build since changes to pom.xml
were ignored.

Additionally, we now build all books whenever some special files
are touched like test.py or doc/pom.xml.

Change-Id: I6e074587093735294f88462db97d398a1ad2e384

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-05 13:55:27.000000000', 'message': 'Make parser.Stack a proper Mapping

We no longer iterate over things in dependency order, so get rid of the
iterator methods that return values instead of keys. Instead, make
parser.Stack conform to the standard collections.Mapping interface.

Change-Id: Id66b2da4ba8e4335c72f1b538abfc2e97eab1e20
'}]
commit_message:
Make parser.Stack a proper Mapping

We no longer iterate over things in dependency order, so get rid of the
iterator methods that return values instead of keys. Instead, make
parser.Stack conform to the standard collections.Mapping interface.

Change-Id: Id66b2da4ba8e4335c72f1b538abfc2e97eab1e20

commit_message:
Refactor and extends the functionality of the TempestConfig

This patch refactor config.py to remove duplicate functionality.
Also, it adds argument passing into the TempestConfig to allow future
changes to the config using CLI arguments.

Change-Id: I5bbedf01ae1da7b32ab54b2793eb714b2f631c25

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V VHDX snapshot bigger than instance

In Hyper-V, the deployed images will be extended having their
metadata size added to their base image size. This may lead to
snapshots bigger than the flavor size.

This patch fixes the issue by setting the image maximum size
accordingly to it's metadata size in case of VHDX virtual disks.

VHDX format specs:
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=34750

Fixes bug:  #1231911

Change-Id: I383ceaa7d809cd13da6554932dcca43ea9bfe29b

for new instances to be able send dhcp requests to the notcompute node.
This may not be required in all cases (some have reported not needing
it) but it is definitely required in any setup I have tried.

Change-Id: I1613706ab19d8ab78a69ce271e8ae70c09bfd1b2
'}, {'created': '2013-09-30 20:52:39.000000000', 'message': 'Allow the gre protocol on overcloud

On Fedora the gre protocol needs to be allowed though iptables in order
for the overcloud to be able to user gre tunnels. This may not be required

commit_message:
Allow the gre protocol on overcloud

On Fedora the gre protocol needs to be allowed though iptables in order
for the overcloud to be able to user gre tunnels. This may not be required
in all cases (some have reported not needing it) but it is definitely
required in any setup I have tried.

Change-Id: I1613706ab19d8ab78a69ce271e8ae70c09bfd1b2

commit_message:
Fix mellanox module loading.

My previous attempt at forcing the mellanox module to load was
completely bogus. This should not be (although I lack hardware to be
100% sure).

Change-Id: I22ff88181c9c9f0c024e021eeb7f16d79715241a
Closes-Bug: #1233949

commit_message:
Fixes rescue doesn't honor enable password conf for v3

The rescue api should honor enable_instance_password conf
setting just like server creation and rebuild api does,
enables this flag will returning the instance password from
server API call rescue, If the hypervisor does not support
password injection then the password returned will not be
correct, this patch just fixes v3 rescue api, since change
return value of v2 could potentially break apps which depend
on this being returned.

DocImpact
Closes-bug #1213866

Change-Id: Ie8422979940bbde8c5749fcd3d6c735e88f78c6a

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-09-28 12:58:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Scott,

Thanks a lot for the change, and excellent content.

As Walter notes, for future reference and review purposes it would be excellent if you could update the commit message to give a few details about what the patch does.

To do this, if you still have the changes saved somewhere, just edit them and run

git commit -a --amend
git review

to update this review :)

If you don't have the changes somewhere, just check out a fresh copy of the openstack-manuals repo and then run

git review -d 48756

to download this particular patch, and then you can use the amend command as above."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2013-09-28 14:44:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Here is the related code:

In latest webtest(2.0.7):

    % (key, type(environ[key]), environ[key]))

In old webtest(1.3.3):
assert type(environ[key]) is str, (
    "Environmental variable %s is not a string: %r (value: %r)"

commit_message:
Unpin WebTest version in global-requirements.txt

If you install OpenStack using devstack, the update.py script from
"requirements" project will be called for each project to align the
requirement files with the global-requirements.txt.

If the project "keytone" is aligned, the run_tests.sh will get many
failures because of "WebTest==1.3.3".

WebTest check the environ with different code in 1.3.3 and 2.0.7:

In old WebTest(1.3.3):
assert type(environ[key]) is str, (
    "Environmental variable %s is not a string: %r (value: %r)"
    % (key, type(environ[key]), environ[key]))

In latest WebTest(2.0.7):
assert type(environ[key]) in METADATA_TYPE, (
    "Environmental variable %s is not a string: %r (value: %r)"
    % (key, type(environ[key]), environ[key]))

Unpin the WebTest version in global-requirement file, the latest
version(2.0.7) will be installed by pip.

Fixed Bug #1219808

Change-Id: Ie129c493a51bc8e96efae2dca650e701b27e7b85

commit_message:
Force link client tools.

If something fails in setup-clienttools you may want to re-run it
at a later time. It seems reasonable to just overwrite pre-existing
softlinks with new ones.

Change-Id: I6690c21632644d72a6f973addd1007a4d98b1221

commit_message:
Ignore empty files returned by curl

In cases where servers ignore the Modified time, curl cancels the
download, outputs a http 200 and leaves the output file untouched, we
don't want this empty file.

Fixes bug #1234926

Change-Id: I05b0dd95dcd53ca50d88ec07f2f1ee9958b6adb7

commit_message:
Enabled request_id in RequestContext

As a means to enable logging on request id's, request_id in the RequestContext
can be set.

blueprint log-request-id

Change-Id: I13cd494d5af3255c03ec30e1040ef01c856c960d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-03 20:30:52.000000000', 'message': 'Handle NetworkNotFoundClient and PortNotFoundClient

neutronclient has changed is behavior (recently?) in that it now
raises PortNotFoundClient for missing ports and NetworkNotFoundClient
for missing nets. These exceptions extend NeutronClientException but
do not set the status_code to 404 so the existing resource 404
checking has stopped working.

This change handles both 404 exceptions and the new exceptions
so that it continues to work with different neutron releases.

Change-Id: Id06e04d4b98e62b8062b119e959634fd61c8beb5
Closes-Bug: #1234924
'}]
commit_message:
Handle NetworkNotFoundClient and PortNotFoundClient

neutronclient has changed is behavior (recently?) in that it now
raises PortNotFoundClient for missing ports and NetworkNotFoundClient
for missing nets. These exceptions extend NeutronClientException but
do not set the status_code to 404 so the existing resource 404
checking has stopped working.

This change handles both 404 exceptions and the new exceptions
so that it continues to work with different neutron releases.

Change-Id: Id06e04d4b98e62b8062b119e959634fd61c8beb5
Closes-Bug: #1234924

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-05 13:55:27.000000000', 'message': "Unit tests: don't use status strings from class

We should always obtain the status strings from the object we're actually
using them with. In this test, the parser.Stack class is actually stubbed
out, which can cause problems for accessing its attributes.

Change-Id: I8e060c6c937542dd11e96f243af26ee4dfa348dc
"}]
commit_message:
Unit tests: don't use status strings from class

We should always obtain the status strings from the object we're actually
using them with. In this test, the parser.Stack class is actually stubbed
out, which can cause problems for accessing its attributes.

Change-Id: I8e060c6c937542dd11e96f243af26ee4dfa348dc

commit_message:
Don't obtain resources through stack.resources

A particular logical resource name can be looked up by subscripting the
stack object directly.

Change-Id: I621280318cfb104ab9bfe1ae7c31fe2b5e55cfc6

commit_message:
Add Manifest in order to include AUTHORS and ChangeLog

Unlike in master, where a different method for creating the
sdist tarball is used, we still need a MANIFEST.in here for
including AUTHORS and ChangeLog in the tarball.

Change-Id: I266b04048c383b4f127d336411937b102bfafab3
Fixes: Bug #979958

commit_message:
Fix hyper-v vhd real size bigger than flavor issue

In hyper-v, after deploy the image, real vhd file size will be
extended from flavor size plus vhd metadata size, this patch
fix this issue by check the vhd type and minus the vhd metadata
size according to the specific vhd type.

Fixes bug #1177927

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/test_hypervapi.py
        nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_vhdutils.py
        nova/virt/hyperv/constants.py

Change-Id: I51223f4f778f33e73dce1e0f53e23e8d7ac77904
(cherry picked from commit 690cf0bdbe57bc05aaf013ab39e050d04a0cd9b7)

commit_message:
stable devstack should default to stable/grizzly

the default git review location was master, not stable/grizzly,
which makes no fun in doing backport patches.

Change-Id: I731c73724274e1f86daded7c0706409807cd5b12

commit_message:
Fix stable/grizzly gating for Neutron (aka Quantum)

The quantum-debug commands would result in:
'ClientManager' object has no attribute 'quantum'

Fixes bug: #1234550

Change-Id: I7f5551c724cfe6d75855eee3433b66bb5ce9b1a4

Fixes bug: 1223754

commit_message:
Moving file flags.py to manila/common/config.py.
Removing deprecated using of flags module from project,
replacing FLAGS by CONF. Rename modules fake_flags to conf_fixture,
test_flags to test_conf, declare_flags to declare_conf,
runtime_flags to runtime_conf like it was done in cinder, nova, glance etc.

Implement bp: use-oslo-conf
Change-Id: I8c2aba652895ed7f377e2ddae9104cef3f211e6d

Change-Id: I6bc34fd2309a9b79906e878af1226d59ddcb5219

commit_message:
Adds additional Hyper-V driver unit tests

This patch adds a consistent amount of unit tests for the *utils classes
which
interface the underalying hypervisor, especially employing WMI calls.

Fixes bug: #1220256

Change-Id: I6bc34fd2309a9b79906e878af1226d59ddcb5219

commit_message:
Add a route to reach the MD server when a subnet is created

When the first subnet is created, the dhcp port is created and
midonet plugin correctly adds the static route to reach the MD
server in create_port. When a second or following subnets are
created, a new ip is added to the dhcp port. This patch takes
care of adding the static route to correcly reach the MD server
in update_port. This fixes the problem of VMs not being able to
reach the MD if assigned to the second subnet

Closes-bug: #1231914
Change-Id: Ifc95f901d4222b76a4254e21295829ac8d82493b

commit_message:
dds additional Hyper-V driver unit tests

This patch adds a consistent amount of unit tests for the *utils classes
which
interface the underalying hypervisor, especially employing WMI calls.

Fixes bug: #1220256

Change-Id: Icab5becd691da4ed7a169fc158bb14eb4c04a260

commit_message:
Reducing the running time for test_sync_execute()

This patch reduces the time it takes for the test method
tests.test_utils.SyncExecuteTestCase.test_sync_execute to
complete its work. The runnig time gets reduced from ~5.0 sec
to ~0.3 sec.

Change-Id: I83bbdea4d12aa1ad5aeeccd1a15c4838ef9c419b
Closes-Bug: #1235791

commit_message:
Add new Benchmark engine

Add Scneraio runer:

1) init scnearion class
2) init scenario
3) call in multiply threads multiple times scenario
4) measure times and exceptions of every loop
5) return results

Use in TestEngine.benchmark ScenarioRuner instead of Tester

Remove unused things from Tester.

Add related tests.

blueprint test-engine-remove-pytest

Change-Id: I6104a2375139a92ad5a0221ec5b085bc3d13dedb

commit_message:
Increase journal size to 64 M for ext4 file system

the problem is that the journal isn't large enough to allow online
resizing. Solution is straight forward. So the file system can be
resized successfully to disk size specified in flavor.

Fixes bug #1233008

Change-Id: Ie84fb8aea8d334706574d1a8006ec9eaee5bb5be

commit_message:
Change Midonet vif driver to generic

Use generic vif driver for Midonet to support port bindings through
the mm-ctl script.

Change-Id: Iddc8a1c7b0128a76cd778c0245f2098bfb2c0145
Closes-Bug: 1235202

commit_message:
Fix typo in property passed to glance

In the upload_image function, a property that is passed to glance in
the vmdk conditional block has a typo. Changes "vmware-disktype" to
"vmware_disktype" (dash to underscore)

Change-Id: I6c4e1875b6ab4544f9742ab08893dae0e86965a0
Closes-Bug: #1235080

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-06 00:28:22.000000000', 'message': 'Use on-demand yum metadata caching in cfn-init

Use on-demand yum metadata caching to avoid downloading
50MB (Fedora 19) of extra metadata that is not necessary
for correct cfn-init operation.

Reduces time to orchestration by about 23% and cpu
utilization by about 50%.

Full detailed analsys in the launchpad bug.

Change-Id: Id51d6d506d6051b5e83f550ef318f86d84f3c7a7
Closes-Bug: 1235824
'}]
commit_message:
Use on-demand yum metadata caching in cfn-init

Use on-demand yum metadata caching to avoid downloading
50MB (Fedora 19) of extra metadata that is not necessary
for correct cfn-init operation.

Reduces time to orchestration by about 23% and cpu
utilization by about 50%.

Full detailed analsys in the launchpad bug.

Change-Id: Id51d6d506d6051b5e83f550ef318f86d84f3c7a7
Closes-Bug: 1235824

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-30 18:51:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix inconsitencies in HOT template guide and spec

Fix description of outputs section in the HOT specification, and thus make it
consistent with the HOT template guide (which is correct).

Also fix incorrect uses of the native server resource's resource name and
attribute names.

Change-Id: I98643873c370d03619ee7df9c7e09b2cdf3cf08c
Closes-Bug: #1233318
"}]
commit_message:
Fix inconsitencies in HOT template guide and spec

Fix description of outputs section in the HOT specification, and thus make it
consistent with the HOT template guide (which is correct).

Also fix incorrect uses of the native server resource's resource name and
attribute names.

Change-Id: I98643873c370d03619ee7df9c7e09b2cdf3cf08c
Closes-Bug: #1233318

commit_message:
resource_data saved unencrypted

Sqlalchemy is commiting unencrypted
data when a session commit happens after
doing a resource_data_get.

Closes-Bug #1233337
Change-Id: I9d20bf1faaf12cc1427976bf1223d4dfc9392c5f

[{'created': '2013-10-04 15:23:28.000000000', 'message': 'Increase timeout for decomission operation

Recently we saw a number of integration tests failure due to timeout
during nodes decommision. Right now it is 30 seconds. There is no
reason to keep it that low, and increasing it to 5 minutes should
help avoid false failures on CI.

Change-Id: Ibaba8a55879a95255beae260647022777938c38f
'}]
commit_message:
Increase timeout for decomission operation

Recently we saw a number of integration tests failure due to timeout
during nodes decommision. Right now it is 30 seconds. There is no
reason to keep it that low, and increasing it to 5 minutes should
help avoid false failures on CI.

Change-Id: Ibaba8a55879a95255beae260647022777938c38f

commit_message:
Some small exception cleanups

Whitespace change and compare directly
to none since user exceptions may have
overloaded the boolean operator and
avoid checking the exception classes
if the input is empty in the first place.

commit_message:
Fix filter_properties of unshelve API

When unshelving a shelved server, nova-scheduler fails because nova-conductor
of current unshelve feature passes an empty list as filter_properties, and
nova-scheduler handles it as a dict.

To fix the problem, this patch changes the filter_properties to an empty dict.

Closes-Bug: #1233563

Change-Id: I2c7a2a743a8142af0be0a182067f3295980aa997

commit_message:
Make sure tempest directories exist when modifying

* devstack-vm-gate.sh: In stable/grizzly and earlier, the
$BASE/new/tempest, /opt/stack/data/tempest and
/opt/stack/new/devstack/files directories may not exist. Look before
you leap.

Closes-Bug: #1235303
Change-Id: Ife6050e82e04b9fd50514d6d65a6dc438661dbf8

commit_message:
Split the creation of $STACK_USER account out of stack.sh

Automatically creating a new user account is not always the right course
of action when stack.sh is running as root.  Plus, the re-exec did not
work correctly in some cases.

* Create tools/create-stack-user.sh to set up a suitable user
  for running DevStack
* Abort stack.sh and unstack.sh if running as root and suggest creating a
  suitable user account.

Change-Id: I5d967c00c89f32e861449234ea8fe19261cd9ae3

commit_message:
update Images API v2 quick ref

The Images API quick-ref docs are still at 2.0 (pre-grizzly).
They need to be updated to Grizzly (2.1, some new calls) and
Havana (2.2, some response body modifications).  "Since" fields
are added where appropriate to indicate when the call was
introduced into the Images v2 API.

Also updated schema examples to illustrate v 2.2 response.

Closes-Bug: #1233793
Change-Id: I5996e27c863212c50ea6a18468d9e5263471126a

commit_message:
Add documentation for Images API v2 image sharing

Image sharing was added to the Images API v2 for the Grizzly release
but was not documented in the API Reference or API Quick Reference.
This commit adds the missing documentation to the Image Service API
v2 Reference.

Also corrects image update example in Appendix A.

Change-Id: I263918ee81c8d7442cb6ef7764231b396a68b1ff
Partial-Bug: #1227801
